title: Awesome
body: Easy to access an maintain. Most helpful app to check my account

title: Nice UI
body: The UI is constantly getting better I like it a lot.

title: Way Better!!!
body: Well done Fidelity  much easier to navigate.

title: Awful App
body: It works for a day  then it will not load.  It crashes.  This has been going on ever since this new version rolled out.  The old one was much better.  I noticed if I deleted the app  then restored it from cloud (re-installed) it would work again ... for a day.  This is an awful app.

title: Nice Updates
body: I like the ease of use and the new design. Also like the customizable daily feed and display.

title: Great
body: Great

title: The more I use it  the less I like it
body: What were the powers in charge thinking. They took an app that needed improvements and made it worse. I now use a separate quote app and only go to Fidelity for trading. It's a shame that it so cumbersome and difficult to navigate. I have found the supposed 30 minute timeout is sometimes as low as 15 minutes before I have to sign in again making options trading troublesome. Don't be fooled by the glitz. I wish I could say something positive. Oh wait  any changes they make will be an improvement.

title: Backgrounds hug
body: Ggggvggh

title: Not impress!
body: Harder to navigate!

title: Don't like the new design
body: It just looks cluttered and is difficult to read. Please fix.

title: S/ be financial ...
body: but designed by some graphics department that never actually uses the functionality. Skip the skylines & the animations. 4-5 years ago this app was way more informative. I rarely use it now.

title: Much improved
body: I feel the new app  the presentation of investment information and overall user friendliness is much improved.  And having it accessible by fingerprint is great!  Well done!

title: Unable to transfer money
body: I am unable to transfer money from my bank to my IRA through the app. The "from bank" is stuck at "Loading Banks".   Please fix it fidelity.

title: Overwhelming
body: For a basic user like myself who only has used the app to review my 401k  this is terrible. Too much and no option to open straight to my account! I don't want a "feed."

title: I love the personal features
body: I think the personal features are great and they are personalized to you . Pretty awesome !

title: Great App so gar
body: I a little new to this app. But so gar its the best I have used so far with up to date market news live trading. Account customization. I must say I look forward to discover more uses.

title: Very Disappointing Iteration
body: It takes longer to load  and that's the best of the worst.   The new iteration defaults to a feed (which is probably why it takes longer to load). It is the default landing tab and cannot be replaced.  The feed is entertainment when this app should be all business. Even the counter for one's balances (clocking through) is unnecessary eye candy and a metaphor for the wrong bias of this design.  I want to know balances and to be able to trade and research  not see what an algo thinks I should see. I want to see credit card transactions (still not available in mobile)  not just payments and rewards  Back to the feed: I don't need to know about random movers (I have triggers). Among those random citations are  for those of us with managed accounts  obscure holdings over which we have no control.   Some people may want a feed. It's even fine if Fidelity wants to make one the initial default. Experimentation is noble. But I should be able to turn it off  and replace it in the nav.  Even then there would be the matter of unnecessarily longer load time  but I'd live with that. But if I could role back  I would.

title: Has exactly what I need
body: Very nice new look and very user friendly. It's pretty cool I can see balances on my Apple Watch without having to go through the whole sign in process. Quite impressed with the new version

title: Not as good as older versions
body: More awkward.

title: Works well
body: I'm an amateur investor and am able to understand the basics from this app.

title: Not so good update
body: Got the new update. I don't like it at all. Just not as simple and easy as the previous version.

title: Font too big. Busy. Don't recommend updating
body: I reverted to an older version because I hate the new look.  Font is way too big and not adjustable so I have to do a lot of scrolling to see all my account info.  There are too many columns in My Positions- is it customizable?  I still have to go through too many screens and taps to get the info I want.  The new version is busy.

title: Great
body: Simple and works great!

title: Too much
body: I wish you offered a simplified version for those like me who have our 401K through our jobs and just want to see the total amount  return rate for the year and JUST a breakdown of how much we and employer match contributed from our paycheck. Then a link to see investments one by one and other options like changing risk and loans. Thanks

title: not customizeable
body: Why are the icons at the bottom not fully customizable?  I just want to remove the useless feed default page and replace it with the accounts page as default?    Also its way to gimmicky for a financial app - when showing the account balance  it counts up from 0 to your balance.  Are the games really needed  can't you allow that as an option if people want to see the numbers flipping?    The large font size can't be controlled which causes little information to be displayed on the screen and makes you scroll all the time to get to information.  Again  could you allow customization to choose what size font should be used?

title: Excellent improvements
body: Good features  improving over time

title: Ease of use is amazing
body: Great functions  means and ability to trade on all levels that I used so far. Fast and very intuitive (for me at least) for review of accounts and trades when  on the road. Recommendable.

title: Fully featured with constant innovation
body: It's a joy to use the fidelity app especially with the frequent updates and improvements. I can almost always get my work done from my phone  intuitively.

title: Great updated App
body: I really like the updated feature of seeing my portfolio gains and market performance on the home screen.  Being able to scroll down one page is very convenient.

title: Fantastic banking app!
body: Definitely 9/10

title: Much better than the last version
Thumbprint log in needed
body: Love everything  just wish it hand thumbprint log in like the netbenefits app!

title: Love it
body: Love this app... Not just fancy graphics but actual useful and productive features.  Good jo. Fidelity  as usual you rock.

title: Much improved w/ recent upgrades
body: Excellent consolidation of research data

title: The new update made it a lot better
body: The app works well  helps me to monitor all my accounts and not have to call anyone. It could be a little easier by maybe setting up a default account to go to  for example when I open my fidelity app I want it to take me directly to my individual accounts.

title: Nice app
body: Latest update makes it slick and easy to use. Especially dig the ease of trading.

title: I like the new version.
body: Functionality is terrific  layout is clean and it is easy to use. I took off a star because it is slow to start up when I open the app.

title: update is too busy
body: I really dislike the update. takes far too many buttons to get where I need. and what's up with that slow animation showing your balance? it really slows me down. this app is not built for traders. I think eye candy is fine but it shouldn't slow me down. please rethink the app to make it more usable.

title: Update Went Entirely the Wrong Direction
body: Follow up:  I just went back to using the mobile browser in Safari.  Very nice.    Please just make it simple and clean. Market news  Portfolio  detailed quotes including one click access to conference calls and analyst opinions  Trade  History  and realized and unrealized gain. Full Stop.    Detailed Issues: 1. I don't like the Feed but can't turn it off. It takes too long to load  insists on showing me a huge graphic display of news on every stock I casually looked at  and mixes them with stocks I actually own. It's a colorful mess and a waste of time  space and bandwidth.  2. Actual news seems to be in More and is also big  busy and "modern". 3. You can't delete the Watch List. 4. Nothing is intuitive to me. I am always looking for something and clicking my way through a path I probably won't find again.

title: Hate the new bells and whistles
body: This isn't what I want from my Fidelity application. Bring back a simpler and cleaner application.

title: Help
body: Get the fidelity apple watch app working asap please thank you

title: New version a slow pig
body: This version of Fidelity Mobile is the worst ever. It's too slow to load. The UI is clumsy. This pig should should be slaughtered.  I've used this app for 5 years and this is the worst Version by far.

title: Check deposit very finicky
body: Automatic check image taking software is very hard to deal with.

title: App upgrade
body: After upgraded the App  my HSA and Brokerage Account were not available to use! Frustrating

title: Great app
body: Short and sweet review but very happy with the app. I have accounts with several brokerages and I use Fidelity more and more because of the app along with the fact that I can do after-hours and international securities trading with Fidelity and quite a few others do not offer international stock trading at all. I won't go into to the nitty gritty of the features but try it and you will see.

title: Slower and less usable
body: New version looks nice but it is bloated and slow. Viewing my account positions is ruined as I have to scroll around sideways and down due to large font and poor layout.

title: Great
body: Everything is terrific  Suggestions to improve 1 ). Ability to check not interested in a topic in feed removing it in future  2) quicker access to data info such as futures (too many steps)   Otherwise fantastic nice job

title: Fancy
body: Love the pictures/background and the personalization. Simple  easy and I love it.

title: Beautiful interface
body: I trade stocks with fidelity  and I am a long time user of the website. This website is innovative  responsive and full of clickable links for navigation. I think it's one of the best banking sites I've ever visited.

title: Slow and Clunky
body: The latest v3 is slow and clunky. The app takes several moments to load. The news feed feature is irritating. This is not meant to be a Twitter or Facebook. The opening of the page should be the account balance.   Earlier version was simple and quick

title: Horrible  Awkward  Slow
body: People who like this app obviously don't trade stocks on a daily basis.  Try using this app to make 20 day trades while setting appropriate stop losses for fast moving stock.  New APP = Slow/Clumsy = Losing money.  You have made trading very difficult for people who need to get in and out of stocks quickly.  Finding and editing open orders is brutal!  This app should be about trading  not pictures of cities.  I need this app to make money not for entertainment. Please re-write the app or make another one available for actual traders.

title: Works well for me
body: Looks great and functionality is enough for what I do on iPhone 6

title: App Review
body: Very Useful APP. Good job!!

title: Awesome Update
body: The new update to the fidelity app is truly awesome. Very friendly user interface. Smooth response. Keep up the good work.

title: Love the app
body: Loving this also for! It's very easy for you to use

title: Fidelity New App
body: Awesome improvements - still getting used to it but a definite solid step in the right direction.

title: Additional abilities
body: Fidelity needs to add the ability to change contribution levels and loan lookup information on all accounts.  I do like the new features added recently but it can be better and more useful online.

title: Love the new look ...
body: Except the logout screen has a weird error message - "Oops unable to login." Strange since it appears AFTER I tap the logout button.

title: Worst upgrade ever
body: Fidelity  you have ruined your app. It is now slow and the columns on the positions page are completely useless. Nothing fits on the screen. I don't need a picture welcoming me to the app  it is a meaningless use of data and hinders performance. I just want the data  that's all. PLEASE go back to the way it was. Terrible.

title: App is solid
body: Nothing blows me away about it. I do wish it gave you options for how long a stock stays on your watch list

title: Not Too Good
body: 1. Font size too big 2. Load speed 3. Scrolling balance count-up very annoying

title: Sneak peak?
body: What happened to the sneak peak feature? Used that everyday.

title: Love it.
body: Quick and easy to use. Very intuitive.

title: Keeps crashing
body: App keeps crashing and will not load. I have the most up to date operation system  and it still does not work. I would not recommend upgrading.

title: sgt
body: Old version was better. Can dispense w the picures. Worthless. Adds no value.

title: Good app but not complete
body: Good app. However does not let you play with IPO's at least. Latest revision us a nuisance. Crashes if I try fingerprint verification and is slow loading with a lot of features I may not be interested in that particular time.

title: Now completely disorganized  slow and confusing.
body: The latest version is absolutely horrendous. They have now put everything everywhere  completely random and disorganized information. The screens are slow to load as a result.  In my last trade  the "last price" shown in an order was 15 min old even though I was logged in.  I was provided a notice that my offer limit price was "above" the asking price AFTER the order was sent.  This update is nothing short of a disaster.    New update - still very unstable  slow  forgets username  unreliable  poor quality coding on the iPhone.  Now it won't allow me to log in. This app works so poorly it will cause you to lose money. Fidelity if your programmers can't make a decent app you need to pull it.  Update -   Fidelity thanks for fixing the freezing and the forgetting of logon information. There are a few additional items I have noticed that I hope you can fix:  1. Add a cash management tool so you can see when your trades will clear and you will have access to the cash. I got a violation because this app isn't providing sufficient information about the cash in my account available for trading and then it is letting me place orders. Why are you letting me get a violation ... You guys are the gatekeepers and make the rules. Don't let your app process the trade!!!   2.  When selling  you have j put the last price in the trade order screen. Make that price dynamic so the user can see it changing when entering limit orders.  3.  Please notify users of special fidelity fees ie in the case of a fund being sold prior to a mandatory duration.  A general warning is not specific enough!!  In general  it should not be riskier to trade with this app than the desktop because the app is buggy or provides less clear info.  Thanks!!

title: A mess of an update
body: - login is still mired with bugs. Logic in to an account is a pretty basic feature. But it's still finicky. For example  when you reset your password online and create a new password  the app will automatically lock you out and then force you to go throug

title: SO SLOW & TOO BUSY AFTER UPDATE
body: Fidelity does better than most banking apps but gosh you overhaul the whole app UI and the FONT IS SO BIG you can only read 4 transactions at once! The content you are actually interested in reading ONLY USES 1/2 THE SCREEN  since the content is the focus why not make the top bar and bottom bars go away? This increases the utility of the app - which should be the goal. Overhauling a UI that was already pretty good does not add a lot of utility. Focus on how many taps a user has to make to complete an action in the app too! Too many steps for simple functions and news feed loading etc.. Come on! Anyway at least 2 stars since Fidelity actively works on improvement to their product  that says  A LOT right there but comeon with the minimal value add for all the work. Im glad to see others complaining about the same issues. Load time is too long  just show me my accounts quickly after logging in!!

title: Touch ID please
body: No touch ID still. I have more login problems with this app than just about any other and I'm not sure why. I've had to reset my password so many time I've lost count. Would be a 5 with that.

title: Love it!
body: Love the ease of use and the research materials!

title: Horrible!!!
body: No option to search for fixed income instruments both new and secondary issues  tried searching for cusip and wasn't found.

title: OK
body: On the news feed  audio doesn't work on video clips. They start off muted  but un-muting doesn't restore audio.   Not thrilled about new layout can't find all the screens and info I used in old version.

title: Don't like it at all!
body: Seems like an attempt to make it pretty.  I want utility  this needs to be efficient.  Stop listening to the propeller heads in marketing and give me an app that I can easily transact in.  People aren't coming to fidelity based on the sex appeal of the app.

title: Lipstick on a pig...
body: I agree with Josephad on May 31:  no change in awkward  cumbersome navigation.  For instance  just to get current Bid/Ask prices on my option orders I have to (1) view the order  (2) click 'Void and Replace' after scrolling to bottom of screen  (3) scroll down resulting screen that NOW gives Bid/Ask  (4) click 'Void' at top right of screen  and (5) scroll down and click 'Cancel void and return to Original Order' ...or something like that.  Fidelity.com gives you Bid/Ask/Last Trade prices for options on a very useful little pop-up screen any time you click on your order...why can't the app be this simple?

title: Placing a trade defaults to first account
body: In the new app you select an account. Then  choose trade at the bottom  and the trade screen defaults to a different account than the one you were on. This already caused me to place couple of trades in the wrong account. Fidelity please fix this! You have to pay attention to the account context.

title: This app is Great !!!
body: All My financial information right there on one page  Along with access to my Fidelity Credit Card statement. How wonderful !!!

title: Great app but new UI takes a bit to get around
body: I really liked the older UI as it was a bit simpler to buy and sell stocks and also transfer balances.  I do like the overall portfolio information display and the tracking features  I also like the Apple Watch integration.

title: New Version
body: This version is fantastic!  Nice job Fidelity.

title: Quick simple trading needed
body: Too much like a news site. Should be a trading tool first and foremost

title: Hate the new layout!
body: I am really disliking the new layout.  When I open the app I either want to go straight to my account info without logging in or at least straight to the account login page. I shouldn't have to hit a separate button to go to account page just to have to login after I opened the app. Most people are using the app to go to their accounts which is the most important thing. If I didn't have an account I wouldn't even have the app. Please return to thinking of the user rather than trying to make it look all pretty.

title: Horrible upgrade
body: Very very horrible upgrade

title: The Latest Downgrade
body: I have an iphone with IOS 9.3.1 which is supposed to be compatible with your latest "upgrade."  Can't get past the "green screen" except through the App Store-Fidelity-Feedback & Support link.   Some upgrade!  Can we expect a fix-of-the-fix soon?

title: Deleted the app immediately.  FOURTEEN page user agreement is no good.
body: Deleted the app immediately. Requires an agreement to FOURTEEN page user agreement that I printed and read. The agreement forces you to accept electronic delivery of all communications and states that if you need a copy... you will need to call Fidelity. There were quite a few other paragraphs that I was uncomfortable with  thing ms that I didn't sign up for when working with Fidelity online.

title: Great app
body: All the info I need.

title: Used to be great  new app stinks
body: This app is bloated and slow. Wish I could go back to the old version.

title: Hard to read
body: Whatever improvements were made in the last update are dwarfed by the selection of a very hard to read font.  It not just a small font but is is also of a light color. Fidelity added pictures that do nothing. They should just concentrate on making a better app.

title: New update
body: I love the new update very efficient in sort ways keep it up hope to see new updates on the app ????

title: Intuitive and well designed
body: I'm not an advanced user but as a novice with basic needs this app has beautiful design and intuitive features. With no major bugs experienced so far  5/5 for me.

title: Easy to use. Has all data.
body: No complaints!

title: I can't think of a way it could be better
body: I love the app and love the plan thanks ????

title: Show me the money...
body: There is a new bug (I can't call it a feature) where the account balance rapidly spins up from zero to the total. It's like an odometer but on fast-forward. This is gimmicky and tiresome. I don't want to wait for it every time. Is there a way to turn off the special effects?

title: Very useful
body: The new vision is user friendly

title: Have the ability to update Full View and view checks
body: Enhanced view much improved over the previous layout for iPhones. It can use some enhancements. Such as viewing cleared checks. Also Add the "Full View" feature found on the website.

title: Rebalancing
body: Please include a column indicating % of each position vs total balance.  Rebalancing should be easy to do  yet it is a hard task the way it is right now.

title: Love the app  one complaint though
body: The screen where it displays your positions is a little squashed. I don't like having to scroll horizantally that much to see information about my positions. Other than that  great app.

title: Good app
body: Works well for watching accounts.  Still not able to do any changes to accounts.

title: Big improvement
body: Really like the fact that you can now view your overall portfolio performance as a graph.

title: Nice refresh to an app I love.
body: Use the app daily as Fidelity is my brokerage  retirement advisor & bank & love the service. Wish the app showed the Boston skyline since it is a Boston company though.

title: Way too long to load the new version.
body: Way too slow to load

title: Powerful and Simple App
body: Great financial app. It's very powerful and simple to use. The new look is clean and makes getting updates and placing trades very easy.

title: Good addition
body: As usual  this new addition is great.

title: Better  but missing full view
body: I still have to use the web site for full view  so I won't use this until that feature is added.

title: WORSE
body: Fidelity spent millions of dollars on this and it's way worse than the old one.

title: Fonts too big. No credit card transactions.
body: The fonts are too big  so you can't see useful details of your account transactions.   Also  the app still doesn't show individual transactions on your Fidelity credit card. I was hoping this would get fixed when Fidelity moved from American Express to Visa  but no! The new cards still don't show transactions.  The animated account balance figures look cheesy. I know the cynical media likes to call investing "legalized gambling" but that doesn't mean you have to make your app look like a progressive slot machine!

title: Works every time
body: One of the most consistent and reliable APP's on my phone.

title: Latest update is pretty but much  much less useful
body: I miss the instant check feature that has been eliminated. Can't find it anywhere in the revised app. Why did you screw up an app that was working well?   The new version is much more cumbersome to navigate. A giant step backwards. I want data  not pretty skyscraper images. This update must have been guided by marketing consultants and not by listening to your users.  Please scrap this version and repost the previous design.

title: Customer
body: Easy to use on mobile... Really great!

title: New version
body: I like the old version better. I can see everything all at once. Too many panels with info. With the new version. Just a huge spreadsheet with everything on it and I can adjust what I want to see as needed will be just fine.

title: Very friendly interface. Strongly recommend!
body: Excellent experience and great features!

title: Slow  slick and useless
body: All improvements were useless and now the app is inefficient  sloppy  choppy and too heavy for its own good. It blows chunks on performance in favor of eye candy. Serious investors can't stand this kind of thing. Novices of Fidelity won't know the difference. I am moving my accounts if the performance is not improved upon in 30 days.

title: Good app
body: Graphs could be better

title: Garbage
body: The new update is just sugar coating for a hard pill to swallow.  The app functions are still incomplete compared to other trading apps and the new update makes it even harder to navigate to what you want.  Just give us something clean and simple with the same functions as the rest of the modern trading apps.

title: Good App
body: There's a bug with the login - Fidelity website allows you to set a user ID up to 20 characters   the app only accept a user ID up to 15 characters.

title: drcailiniirish
body: This app is horrible ! Too long to load   too cumbersome   no clear and concise ways to do easy things like deposit a check   look at accounts . Way too much going on that is just taking up space !  keep it simple !

title: Nicely Updated
body: New update looks great!

title: Slower Than Previous App
body: Resonse time is slower to update account information.  Also  I don't care about your news feed but it can't be turned off.  Don't waste my time and data looking at it every time I launch the app.

title: Terrible update
body: The most recent app update is horrible. Login times have quadrupled. Can't see a stock chart more than ten days out. New menus are counterintuitive in a mind-boggling way.  Way too much overthinking went into this one at the expense of common sense.

title: New look new features
body: The new app is much better than older versions. No longer have to go to a computer for updates on my watch lists. The custom feeds deliver information in a great way. Feels like a social network for investing

title: Worthless
body: Had trouble with getting the app to show the bank account I connected it with to transfer funds. Called customer service and got the issue resolved. Once the app updated  the same problem returned. Upon calling customer service again I was told to delete the app and reinstall. Still not working. When I contacted customer service again  I was told "we see it on our end  not sure why you aren't seeing it on yours."

title: Works great!
body: The App Works great for me. I just need a bit of information when I sign in and it give it to me in a hurry. It also allows me to trade in and out of different funds easily.

title: Good app
body: Recent changes are good which shows portfolio summary and the news  market overview in very easy and quick glance. Good improvement.. One thing will be better if it shows the company's upcoming earnings dates based on what stocks you own.
I want to be able to pay my credit card here too.

title: Love addition of news feed
body: The recent update to include a news feed personalized to your individual account is genius. Great way to find important information about my investments and topics important to me. Much easier than having to go find this information myself. Makes app much more useful because I do not only use it for looking at my accounts  but I use it for news/research.

title: Good app
body: Easy to use

title: Wait this is a financial app?
body: Awesome. So clear and easy to use. Beautiful.

title: I Miss the Old App!!
body: I don't like the latest update. First  it takes way too long to open (I'm starting to really hate that green screen)  and then it slowly initializes or refreshes  etc.  Once you're in  it seems like it requires a lot of scrolling past things I don't need to see  like when I just want to see stock quotes or whatever. Finally (and this is frustrating)...I have my app settings set for me to see real time quotes  with no delays  and my balances  but I get neither without having to log in repeatedly. I miss the old app!!

title: I like the new look

title: Flashy look but way too slow

title: Feeling Geriatric

title: A wealth of information at the fingertip

title: Well done

title: Like the new UI

title: Love it!!

title: Looking good but can't find my profile information

title: Welcome change.

title: New Fidelity app
body: Very well done  really like the improvements and layout!!

title: Bigger But Not Better
body: As is the case with many app developers  the attempt to "improve" only results in a bigger and slower app with new features that don't bring a lot of benefits while still missing others that would be useful.   How hard would it be to extend the history of activities to a longer look back period and to show closed positions and closed tax lots?  I can't even tell what's new and more useful!
Would do again

title: Freeze
body: Slow and freezes alot????

title: Not tested on iPhone?
body: When you go type the alert price  the keyboard does not let you see the field...come on

title: This must be the Alpha version
body: This updated version loads so slowly if it loads at all. It looks like it reloads the portfolio every time you select a new item. It should not take seconds to display the balance with the annoying number counter. I would give 1/2 star if I could.

title: Newbie
body: New to retirement and put all my eggs in one basket here at Fidelity. Very reassuring to be able to  literally with a touch of a finger  to see my nest egg. Calling through the app instead of the 800 number bypassed all the rigamarole of self identification.

title: New app
body: I love the feel of the redesigned app took me a while to locate myself with in but afterwards it was easy as Barbecue Chicken. Would like a better time table displayed on when shares were sold or bought specially for shares bought at a discount through my employer to better manage my investing and alert me when i can sell or buy more again.

title: 3.0 does not work on iphone 4s
body: This is bad. Iphone 4s does not work with 3.0

title: Portfolio section
body: When looking at individual account  why can't you sort the vertical columns the way you want to? What if you want the order rearranged to quantity  total gain/loss  daily gain/loss  etc...and mix and match how you please?

title: Fidelity Rocks It
body: This is perhaps one of the best and most well-written applications that I have had the pleasure of using. I strongly recommend using this app for trading for investing and for managing your online the Fidelity accounts. I am sure you agree with me that using this application will enhance your investing experience.

title: Why why why
body: Don't u guys show what the calculations are when u enter in shares and prices. Instead of flipping back and forth.

title: Love the recent updates
body: I'm happy that we have the ability to open accounts using the app.  Also love the additional research functionality.

title: Quick Access not working with this new update
body: Please fix.

title: I love the New Loo
body: The new look is beautiful!!

title: Update Needs update!
body: I'm a long time user of Fidelity and there mobile app. This update has some bling but has some flaws that need to be addressed 1. Quick access only works 25% of the time at best. 2. App locks up and just spins. You have to stop and restart the app to even log in. I use this app a lot but until it is more dependable I'm stopping completely.

title: Issues with quick view
body: Some cosmetic improvements  but bugs galore especially related to quick view.  Freezes to the point of needing to delete and reinstall.

title: New app
body: I don't like the layout or opening homepage that is hard to view your stocks and not user friendly. I also don't like the slot machine style when showing your balances. Cheesy.

title: Crashes upon launch!
body: Update June 6  2016:  - Crash upon start. Shows the Fidelity green screen and freezes.  ----  Just got the latest update and it wouldn't start... :(  -----  Great design but implementation has fall short. I need to edit my iPhone Watch List but you can't. UI a bit confusing. And start up quite slow--must be a lot fast of this we're to be my main go-to investment app.  Just identify the issues and fix them RIGHT AWAY please.

title: Awful update
body: The app once ran smooth and was simple. Now it takes forever to load if it ever does!!! The feed completely locks up the app when all you want to do is check your balance but nooooooo gotta load all this crap. ????????

title: Bring back the old app
body: Personally  I find the new app to be incredibly cluttered and prefer the old one much better. I wish there was an option to go back to the old format. Hopefully someone at Fidelity reads this.

title: Terrible update
body: Very annoyed that Fidelity chose to change a clean  reliable financial app into an annoying new version with dumb animations  bizarre navigation and frequent freezes. Please give us the option to use the former app!!!

title: Very bad
body: After download the new version  cannot open the app  always the first page showing on the screen.  It is very very slow  not easy to see what I want to see.  Fidelity IT is the worst within all the investment firms I use.  Prepare to transfer my money and leave.

title: Nice  but...
body: It can be very slow to load.   V.e.r.y.  S.     L.     O.    W.

title: Crashing and layout
body: June 6th update.    Now the app takes 5 minutes just to open.     Fidelity  terrible job on this app  it shakes my confidence...  Using the app for bill pay and it crashed several times.   Also the layout doesn't convey the trust I must have in Fidelity.   It looks like a game.    Financial institutions must convey a solid state.    This app looks transparent.    Not happy at all...

title: New app won't open
body: I liked the new app when I first updated  but now  a week later  it won't open at all and the Fidelity screen just sits there. Help! Please fix this! I have an iPhone 6 with newest OS update. (I rebooted phone- still no luck)

title: Okay  but...
body: While the update does modernize the user interface  the feel is not as considering as the prior iterations. One pet peeve is the scrolling count-up of the account balance is really cheesy!  Also  my long standing gripe about how mutual fund daily gain/loss during the trading day is displayed still exists. I think that the current day gain/loss for mutual funds should be zeroed out at the start of the trading day. Mixing the prior trading day's gain/loss for mutual funds with the current day's gain/loss for stocks really skews the totals. At the very least the total gain/loss shown should use the "Today's Change" from the positions page.

title: Pretty. Slow. Both.
body: I like the new look a lot  but it seems to load slower. Overall a plus though.

title: Pretty good app
body: Much more convenient with thumbprint sign in!!!!

title: Slow and cumbersome
body: The new 3.0 version on my iPhone 6 is very slow  too many informs that I don't need. Give me the old version back!

title: Too many bells and whistles
body: Latest update DOA on a 4S.  Now I have no iPhone access.  Nice job.

title: New Version of App
body: Hate it! It's slow to open  the Market Data is difficult to read and it's difficult to maneuver through the App. Bring back the old App!!

title: App gets stuck on splash screen
body: Otherwise when it does load it works fine...

title: Startup issues
body: Freezes and app won't open

title: Won't Launch
body: The app will no longer launch. Not sure if it's related to the update or not.

title: Oops-Oops-Oops

title: Does not work all the time
body: It fails to open on my iphone 6 plus. The old version was opening automatically and working fine. The new fidelity app does not open all the time and takes longer time than the old version.

title: New version doesn't load.
body: I'm using an iPhone 6 and the new 3.0 version doesn't load at all. Horrible "update."

title: App Will Not Open
body: Love the app but it will no longer go past the "Fidelity" image when opened. Freezes every time. Restarted the phone  still nothing.

title: Good but bad load times
body: Good info / pretty design and UX. But  heavy app that takes to long to load up and get to the info I'm looking for. Need to streamline app. Using a iPhone 6s.

title: Fidelity app
body: Works great!

title: Huge improvement.
body: Love the new app. Clean  fast  efficient. Thanks for updating it!

title: New iPhone interface
body: I want the old version back.  I cannot see more than a couple positions at once.  The old version displayed many positions and gave good comparative data.  That's my main complaint.

title: Really Spectacular
body: Beautiful  spare & packed with info. I think it's been created to keep investors on the site longer. That's certainly going to happen with me. Thank you for such a visually beguiling site  it's really important to this investor. Most of the changes to the large website I haven't liked at all. I love the changes to my iPhone's real estate.

title: Great app
body: You can count on this bank  they are on there job

title: App functions and looks great
body: Beautiful redesign. Intuitive navigation much improved by moving to the bottom of the screen. Tasteful personalized home screen. And I love the new font. I use the app primarily to access cash management and savings accounts. Very beautiful financial app.

title: Terrible upgrade
body: The old Fidelity app was very user friendly and my only complaint was inability to see statements or transfer funds out. The new app is filled with useless screens  makes reviewing my fund status less clear and still doesn't allow access to statements or to transfer funds out. Terrible upgrade!

title: Crashed
body: Crashed when I tried to deposit a check  which is all I use it for.

title: Most recent Fidelity iPhone update
body: The new update offers a very nice upgrade in customer usability. There is  however  at least one additional feature I would like to see addressed. I daytrade  mostly options  and would find it extremely useful to initiate conditional orders with the iPhone app.

title: Much better...
body: Upgraded version is much more informative and easier to use.

title: Finally!
body: Finally  a mobile website that is of the quality you would expect from a heavy-weight like Fidelity! Excellent website!!

title: Bring back quick access!
body: I just want to see the balance. Ugh.

title: Amazing App!
body: Lots of bells-and-whistles added to a previously bare bones iPhone app.  The International Markets graphic  showing global activity at a glance  is epic.  I missed that from the iPad app.  Touch ID for the next version please?  It's a good security feature for logging on in public places and it's really quick.  My credit cards have it.

title: Good improvements in new UI
body: Touch id is a good improvement. New UI much easier to read...

title: Lots of fluff
body: Pretty  but not very functional. Not the kind of update that was needed. Images are unnecessary and the large fonts make looking at details difficult. Take a look at the TD Ameritrade app and learn please.

title: Updates
body: Love the updates that have been made and the customizable feed.

title: Hate the update
body: I loved being able quickly find my watch list and see the current prices and account balances.  Now it takes forever to get any information. I hate the changes.

title: Too flashy  less useful
body: I like the added research and tools.  It  is slower to load. You have to login twice to get to your accounts. The spinning slot machine in very annoying. There is too much space between line items  meaning there is less info on each screen. The opening picture is too busy. You say it is customizable  but when I login I want to see the indices or my accounts first. Viewing the accounts was better in the previous version.

title: Very good app
body: Wow.. What can I say? This app update looks great and is functional. Great job fidelity!

title: Good Functionality
body: I can do most of the same online things as thru the desktop site. Love the Touch ID because my password is super long  so this gives easy secure access. I would of gone this a 5 but the news content could be more cutting edge.

title: A modern mess
body: Yea the app was "modernized" but you can't actually see anything. The headers must take up more than 50% of the screen space thanks to huge fonts and lots of spacing. Landscape mode doesn't help much either. There's now another screen between login and me seeing my portfolio with some nonsense cityscape background. Out of place for a financial app. I used to use the app exclusively but now will use the browser and only app in an emergency. This will reduce the number of trades I make and hence hurt Fidelitys bottom line unintentionally

title: Slow slow slow and lots of clicks
body: Very slow and more clicks than ever. Bad UX design and slow response. Weak.

title: App
body: The new app is very helpful! I love it.

title: After latest UI update.
body: The app freezes after 3 min of use. Can't log off. Just have to close app with hard close. Iphone 6. 401k.  All updates installed. Had no problems before.  The market is not doing well on my app. I need more optimistic   numbers.

title: Great app
body: I really enjoy the Fidelity app.  I use it every day!

title: It's ok

title: Great visuals

title: Old app was better

title: Lots of pretty pictures

The new font shows much less info with more scrolling when looking at positions  even on my 6plus.  I deleted this and reinstalled the old version from a backup. That’s an upgrade if you want function over flash.

title: Playtime version
body: Please allow us to disable the very slow "feed" which only wastes time. Would prefer to see numbers  now we have lots of white space and animations.  Why would you design the app to show less data? Do you think we like to tap and scroll? How about some options to tighten up the display to get more content and less lessness. And an option to turn off the silly feed gimmick.

title: nice upgrade

title: Worst changes ever  but good ideas

title: Fidelity App

title: Test your software before releasing
body: I can't even use the app to do transfers into my Roth IRA anymore. Neither of my banks show up on the drop down list. I suggest testing your software before releasing full updates. I'd give this update a zero star rating if it was possible.

title: Hate the "feed"
body: Huge downgrade--does not show positions first. Feed is fluff  unimportant and in the way  yet fidelity made it the default.  Position screen is poorly formatted  even on an iPhone 6 screen. Limited columns and rows are visible now. Really poor UX.  Clunky  begs for reviews. Tracks your usage

title: It Crashes!

title: Nice Update

title: Huge improvement over old app
body: Way easier to navigate and has far more information

title: New update to Fidelity is awesome
body: Very intuitive UX with new fidelity app.

title: Let us turn off the "feed"
body: Love Fidelity. Hate the new app.   All I want from this app is to check my balances and trade. As things are now  upon opening the app  I have to sign in  then wait for the "feed" to load before clicking another button to either check balances or trade.   There is currently no way to turn off or bypass the feed.   Fidelity  you are slowing me down. Don't impede my progress.

title: Great improvements
body: Love the new details & info! More user friendly.

title: Good

title: Fidelity app
body: The new app is awesome and easy to navigate.. Checking my future every day

title: Good app
body: Clean interface  good news feeds and easy to find the I do I am Looking for when I want

title: Multi accounts portfolio
body: Since the new "updated" I find the app to be overly filled with flashy images and "ads" which obscure my ability to glance at my positions and get updated info.  Many of he images are too large and could easily be condensed.  Any tablet or smartphone allows the user to enlarge or shrink images. We don't need images for the visually impaired. !!  The app seem more Designed for the benefit of marketing than for the convenience of account holders

title: Update

title: Update seems to have broken Apple Watch Fidelity app

title: Good

title: The new version is ok
body: The new version is ok. It's a little sticky on iPhone 5s with current iOS as of this date. I like the organization  but the colors and the aesthetics leave something to be desire inmo.

title: This lousy "upgrade" of Fidelity app
body: Terrible result for my purposes. Youse made it too involved/time consuming for me. It loads slowly  gives me too much undeletable crap to wade through  and   in short  I am very  very  very disappointed.

title: New update looks great!

title: Crashes on 4S

title: Update Faiiled message on home screen
body: Update Faiiled message on home screen at startup.  Keeps recurring.  Also startup process too slow.  I am on iOS 9.3.2  iPhone 6.

title: Not so good on iPhone 5
body: Most print is too dim.  Some is too small. Is app paying attention to iPhone Settings?

title: Requesting a feature
body: Please report insider buy/sells in the last 3 months as a column on the watchlist...and keep up the good work !!

title: It wasn't broke - why change it?
body: The old app was great - clear  easy to navigate & do what you wanted. This is glitz & image  harder to navigate & do things. WHY did they change it?

title: Great update
body: Love the layout and all of the information available.

title: Slow going
body: It takes several minutes for the app to open.

title: Getting better everyday
body: I love the new app layout  I agree with being able to sign into multiple accounts with Touch ID  as  others have stated  I can do this with my capitalone account. Specially since for some reason I have tried to merge my wife and my accounts and there is always 1 account that doesn't show on each profile so I have to sign in and out a lot. I also miss the Reuters quick video updates  bloom burger tv is good but I want a quick 5-10 video run down in the am and right before markets close. I don't always want a live stream when I have 10 minutes to kill and want to see what is new in markets. The Apple Watch app still needs some work. Great improvement though

title: Destroyed a great app
body: Latest update turned this into a news app  reduced utility for following accounts & crashes due to new fancy graphics which have no utility.   There are many news apps on sticks  but now  no decent working app for Fidelity account holders.  Tragic evidence of how "exciting improvements can destroy utility & basic function by reducing customizable elements.  Sad.

title: Stuck at first screen
body: No one needs these endless feeds. Also  fonts and columns not adjustable make this app difficult to use. Please revert back to the old app. Today it's even worse  completely stuck at the first screen.

title: Terrible
body: The old apps was much better. This one does not handle the graphs as well.

title: Some good.  Most bad.
body: Good: 1 Finally futures quotes. Would be better if they had own tab and were not delayed. But I will take this as a first step.   2 Easier to see outstanding orders. Trading screens are improved and cleaner.   ***Bad: 1 Overall loading information seems to take much longer than old app. I hope this gets worked out in future updates. Cannot deal with reading "loading" as frequently as I have to at this point.   2 "Feed" is too cluttered. Too cute for my use. Please let me disable that tab and add one more useful to me. (Another plug for a separate futures tab). One tile/card takes up almost the entire screen for a single stock.  There should also be an option to exclude mutual fund holdings from the feed.   3 Watchlist font/spacing needs work. I wear bifocals. Yet I still find the spacing on the watchlist to be overkill. I don't need equity name. Space between rows could be smaller to allow more information on a single screen. Like the Feed  too much empty space.   4 Accounts tab. I can see balance in an account on main screen. Then for some reason I have to wait for the cute odometer count up when I look at an account to see holdings. It's only a half second or so.  But that's enough to get me to move to a diffent app to monitor my holdings.  5 After hours price updates also seem hit or miss.  Refreshing my accounts proice flips from prior close to pre market price and back.  Annoying.  ******If you use this once a day  the changes are probably fine. If you use this more frequently to trade/monitor  this is not for you. I know Fidelity has a different customer base than IBKR. If they want to keep the more active clients that have  this will not do it.   Please make a mobile version of Active Trader Pro.

title: Bring back the old app
body: This update is inferior to the old app in just about every way.  First  it is horribly slow.  Second  you can't customize the font size.  Like others have said  we need to be blue to see as many positions as possible on one screen (within reason).  It's pretty  but I don't really care for that.  I want information available quickly and succinctly.  I only gave it 2 stars because it is still usable.  Otherwise  a single star for sure.

title: Larger  not better
body: It looks nice & colorful but it is too bulky. Looks like the program was written for a laptop not a phone. The font is too large and there is no adjustment to make it smaller. The custom feature is nice but not as important as being able to see more stock info in your accounts on the page. Sliding back and forth is annoying. Cannot customize column info or the order they appear. I prefer the older version.

title: Better
body: I have been a part of many updates  but this latest update is amazing.  It's exceedingly user friendly and just gorgeous to look at.

title: Wonderful
body: I enjoyed the upgraded app. Easy to navigate.

title: Getting better
body: Touch ID is a good start  but still needs some updates for different phone sizes. Like the new updates
username: The truth is out there find it

title: New version slower
body: The update is pretty  but the trade off is that the app is quite a bit slower now.  Quite frustrating.

title: Cosmetic updates  new bugs
body: Depositing checks is no better than before  and worse in some ways. Now it hangs and doesn't deposit checks.

title: Faster
body: Nice work guys!

title: Much better than before
body: Easy to use and more intuitive and looks much better

title: Pretty good
body: Well organized; easy to use. Excellent design.

title: Rubbish! New App much worse
body: The new app is window dressing. Making if "look" good with cute graphics while adding no new functionality and making it actually harder to do the simplest tasks. Fire whoever conceived of this garbage. I can't even begin to list all the deficiencies. One main gripe; I keep most of my portfolio in ETFs and Fidelity doesn't graph ETF performance  in the APP. I can google or yahoo the symbol and get a nice graph  but not on the app. Also  the navigation is actually worse than before. Far from intuitive  tedious and confusing. Come on!

title: New Update Works Well on iPhone But NOT on Watch
body: The new update works well on the iPhone except for being able to find what date mutual fund results are from.  The one exception is the loss of the ability to get a quick view of current portfolio balances without having to log in.  The watch part of this app is nearly unusable.  Attempts to access portfolio balances mostly fails with either the Oops message about not being able to load balances or just hangs trying to load the balances.  Both iPone and watch are at the latest software versions.  The watch app is now essentially unusable and I have deleted it from my watch.  Thanks for screwing up what had been a very usable app.

title: Well thought out design.
body: Everything is very natural.  I especially like the watchlist update which I often forgot to check.

title: Game changer
body: The app looks so dramatically different now but it's awesome. I really feel like I'm getting a great point-of-view at a macro level with this app.  One thing that I haven't seen from any of the financial investment apps that would truly separate this app from the rest of the competition would be unbiased news stories from the local markets media. For instance  South China News puts out quality articles on the state of the Chinese and Hong Kong markets that I don't get with any American companies.  I think that during times like this obtaining different angles to view macro issues is important.   Great job again guys!

title: Design update 2 steps backward
body: Hey UI designers  please use less spacing between stocks within portfolio views.  There's no benefit to having large column heights.

title: Much better  but...
body: New interface is a great improvement. News feed is a useful addition. Still need the ability to view external accounts along with Fidelity balances.

title: Awful Interface
body: There are so many reasons not to like the new app:  Font is too large  making more scrolling necessary.   Interface goes through time consuming image loading which is unnecessary.   The "feed" on the main screen is nonsense and soaks up bandwidth.

title: Very Nice and Feature-Rich
body: All the features I need and frequently use are in this app plus sooo much more! Clean and sleek interface with the new update.

title: Pleasant to use
body: Visually appealing. Easy to navigate. Seem intuitive. My watch app does not load my personal account info  though

title: Awesome New Look!
body: Love the new look  very easy to navigate and very intuitive. EXCELLENT!! Great Job!!

title: Love the new look
body: The new app is so much better and customized. Love it

title: New site
body: Looks great but too cumbersome to open!

title: Great update
body: I love this app! It has so many great new features I find myself playing with it all day. Information available on this app is truly amazing.

title: Touch ID Makes the Difference
body: Finally! A welcomed update  long overdue in my opinion. The app goes from ok to awesome just like that.

title: What was Fidelity thinking?
body: I've been using the latest version. Someone in their infinite wisdom has decided to remove the bid/ask price on a trade. How do they expect us to trade without this information  especially where the range might be wide? This is definitely not an improvement on the old app.

title: Does a lot looks great but super sluggish!
body: Love the new look  but the sign in and load times take way too long.   If you make it snappier - it would get 5 stars!   For now  it's so slow that it's a 3 star app!

title: Modern and useful
body: Great app

title: Mixed reviews of update
body: With the recent update  the app is slower & less responsive. One new addition I do like is having the analysts opinion shown for each stock on the positions page. However  I wish they'd discard pictures & cute graphics. What a I really want is to get to my portfolio as quick as possible. It seems to take an extra step to get to my account and it loads more slowly.

title: New Fidelity Interface
body: The new interface appears to be catching up to expectations. Well done to the developers.

title: Form Over Function

title: Awesome App!
body: I like the overhaul made to the App. It takes few days to get used to the new changes. They were needed. The only feature that I wish you to consider is the ability to refresh the stock price while placing the order thru the app. Unfortunately  you need to key in the symbol again to get the most recent price! Thank you.

title: Simple
body: Love the design and simplicity of the app. Definitely recommend!

title: Good improvements
body: Now it is much easier to do research on stocks.

title: Bring back the previous version
body: The Feed is an unnecessary obstacle to accessing account info. In general the old version allowed for easier access to your info. The positions pages contain too many columns and the fonts are too large  causing considerable scrolling to find info that could previously be seen in a quick glance  this version is more suitable for a large screen iPad than an iPhone

title: Yes!
body: Functional  reliable  pleasant to look at.

title: Waste of time
body: The new app displays a somewhat customizable "Feed" every time you open the app.   You can't opt out or shut it off  but it takes about seven seconds to load every time you open the app  even on high-speed Wi-Fi. Even within the app  whenever you come back to the feed it takes a few seconds to update. Total waste of time when you just want to get to your accounts or start a transaction. Can't believe they don't give us the option of turning off the feed or turning it into a simple list of holdings (which show up in a seemingly random order) without the splash graphics which slow it down.

title: so far so good
body: I

title: Great
body: Does what it's supposed to

title: Version 3.0 is totally worthless
body: If you download the new version be prepared to stop transacting. New version completely wiped out the ability to transfer funds into a trading account. Warning! If you download V.3.0 it requires you to re-submit your banking information. Terrible update  just floods you with more noise.

title: Best among all
body: This new update is making this app the best ever of its kind. Simply brilliant design and incredible functionality! I love the feed section  carefully tailored info for anyone to learn

title: Horrible Update
body: The updated app is terrible for several critical reasons.  First  it is extremely slow.  People want to know balances of their accounts and activity QUICKLY without having to click.  It shouldn't take 15-30 seconds and several clicks just to get to accounts summary.  Second  whoever signed off on the "Feed" idea is out of touch.  Fidelity is not Facebook.  Nobody is going to care about the garbage in that feed.  Alternately  why can't you default to Accounts view by just using the fingerprint login?  Just a bad update overall that tries to turn a simple app into Fidelity Facebook.

title: Love the company hate the app
body: The new app is horrible IMHO. The old one wasn't much better. They should keep it simple and easy to use.

title: New App Even Better!
body: Other app was great  but now it's even better!

title: Where is my Device watchlist?
body: With the latest update my device watchlist is not loading anymore.

title: I liked the last version better
body: I was very comfortable with the last version of this app.    Now I have to look at a skyline that zooms in and out and gives me a headache while the app loads (slowly)  Then I can only see 4 of my stocks and only two columns of data because the font is so large.    You can't change the font so far as I can see   Also while I am waiting to see what my account balance is the number rolls up like a winning slot machine and that makes me nervous.  I think it makes me nervous because I am afraid the number will stop well below what I expect.   Luckily I haven't experienced this on a poor day for the stock market so I can mentally prepare myself    I have been a fidelity customer since I was 19 years old.  Fidelity please change this app back to the way it was before !

title: New update

title: Great update!

Only item I see as a suggestion would be  once you place your order and it resets to put in another order  that your remaining balance is shown.

title: Like the new look
body: Looks a lot better

title: Modern look and feel but still lacks critical elements
body: So I just tried the new interface of the new and improved app and here is my scoop on it.  The good-the interface looks  feels nice and modern  definitely a departure from the old app. Most of the functions are the same.  The bad-I use fidelity for my brokerage accts  my cash management Acct and my fidelity credit card. I have a few Huge complaints that need to be addressed ASAP 1) bill pay-very primitive and takes way too long to post to the account. There is a portion of the day on the day after the payment is initiated (on standard 1-2 day bill pays)where the payment simply vanishes From record. It's not in pending nor is it in posted. I have panicked once and made the payment again during this period  only to realize my original payment posted the next day. I like the chase model the best for Bill pays  the second you initiate the bill pay  the second it should come out of your available balance. Period.

The day change charts are nice in the Position view  but it would be good to see those for the life of the position  too.  Font size in the Position view is too big.

title: Version 3 has ruined what was a great app
body: The new version  3  has ruined the fidelity mobile app. The user interface is now nothing like the web client. Menu navigation is lacking and the font is huge (so now much less data is available in view - positions for example).   Trading with the app is now terrible thanks to the new User Interface.   Upon logging in  it feels like advertising is being presented (described as "feeds").  It is disappointing that a new version has broken what was already a great application. This is terrible. I have no use for this app. What was once a pleasure is now ruined.

title: New Fidelity App is GREAT!
body: Have only been playing with the new release for about an hour  but I am thrilled with the added capabilities - I may never go back to the desktop again.

title: Fidelity App
body: The enhancements are great! However  there still is a considerable gap in logic relative to bill pay  available balances  EFT deposits are generally taking way too long to be credited  and it's super confusing as far as understanding available balances for bill pay. The available amount for withdrawal should always be the same as the amount for bill pay. Translation  bill pay should be immediately deducted to produce an accurate available balance.

title: Decent app- technology still far behind competitors
body: This app looks good. The problem is it follows the old Wall Street saying "put some lipstick on the pig". First there is too much real estate used for  the iPhone 6. There is no font or column adjustment. I currently have 7 positions and can't see them on s single screen. In the old app I could. They also continue to ignore the basic fundamental requirements of a mobile trading app  such as real-time updates on all positions and trades. If you add to a position  the current day pricing information goes away!! Unbelievable  unheard of in today's trading apps. Also no "Close Position" option on a sale. You must type in the basic  information before hitting send  unbelievable! On a new buy  the trade screen doesn't display "funds available to trade"  you need to know or remember to look it up before going to the trade screen! Once you set up a limit order and the bid/ask price changes  it doesn't update the limit price  you have to re-type it! By far the most frustrating issue remains the antiquated technology platform  specifically the lack of true realtime position updates. For a firm like Fidelity  with their impeccable reputation  there technology is a real black eye.

Custom feed that tells me everything relevant at the top with drill downs into my account as I scroll  and relevant news about my sectors.  If I want to drill into my accounts  I click the "accounts" button at the bottom (it has been moved there from the side nav...perhaps that's throwing people off :-))  Plus  the overall 1 year g/l seems new  I don't remember seeing that across all accounts before. Balance counts up from zero and doesn't show for three seconds (it's silly and useless; quit showing off and just display my balance). The feed is awful  but at least the app says good morning  good evening  and has pleasant pictures. Phew! Pretty sure they were trying to copy the (actually useful) Chase app there...
