Fidelity your poor app development and testing IS COSTING ME MONEY and this might be the last straw for me.  Ameritrade here I come :( BTW navigation stinks too- stop making it like FB.

title: Excellent app
body: Good

title: Update
body: Already was a solid app. With this update it allows u to check ur stock quotes without logging in every time to get real time updates... That was my only real complaint before and they addressed it perfectly! Does what I need it to do and easily.

title: Ios 8 beta 5 crash

body: This version has a race condition where the user must accept terms and conditions  but an "Accounts Loading" window is on top  preventing the user from pressing Accept.

title: What happened to it???

title: Love it very happy with fidelity
body: Very happy with fidelity no atm fees makes them unbeatable.. Satisfied and hope they prosper

title: Can't log in!!
body: Cannot log in anymore and gone is the ability to "paste" unto the password field. I use the longest and most complicated passwords that a financial website allows for added security and I rely heavily on the ability to copy paste my passwords into my apps. They are too complicated to type in one by one. THAT IS THE POINT!!  There is no good and valid reason to remove the ability to paste my password into the password field. Fix this now!

title: Horrible update

title: Can't login

username: Guess I'm not who I think I am

title: Too slow
body: Nice UI but new 2014 app too slow to respond on my iphone 4 after unlocking it. Should not have to sign in every 30 mins if I already have a passcode set on phone.  Need cost basis per share column available

title: Needs a new update!
body: This version has too many glitches!!! Freezes up easily.

title: App doesn't update quotes!
body: Not adequately tested before release!!  No excuse for an important financial app that is used for monitoring and making investments not being properly tested before release.

title: Ok except really difficult to log in
body: I don't normally write reviews but was motivated to do so for Fidelity because I was shocked at how such a large financial institution can create such a poorly functioning app. Half the time I can't log into my account n

title: Can't log on
body: Just downloaded this app and can't log on. I have no idea how to get on and if the app is helpful.  Please fix the bug.

title: Bug on check deposit  the rest is OK.
body: When you try to deposit a check  you can't type the amount if your phone regional settings are configured to other countries like Spain  for example. The number just disappears after you press the second digit because in Spain the decimal separator is a comma instead of a dot. You can't continue without entering the amount so the whole check deposit is useless. As a workaround until this is fixed  you can change the regional settings in your iPhone. (Settings->International)

title: Terrible
body: This update is much worse than the previous version.  They added a bunch of fluff but buried the limited functionality that the app had under more fluff to make it less user friendly.

title: It won't let me sign in
body: I just signed in on the computer but it keeps giving an error when I try to sign in on the app

title: Will wait for future fixes
body: After reading other reviews I decided not to update the app. If the developers do read the reviews I would like to be able to see how much a stock is up or down on my positions page besides for just seeing percentage gains. Seems self explanatory.

title: Poor Update
body: Market Gainers/Most Active/Losers NEVER Updates after refreshing many times & sometimes even after restarting app  Quotes are always very delayed even though says current time  wish I could downgrade back to previous version  Please fix bugs  Thanks

title: Crashed at first try!
body: Crashed at first try!

title: Bad upgrade experience
body: No graceful handling of upgrade. Forces you to find a desktop and blocks your account until you use a desktop.

title: App now won't work
body: My company 401(k) used to be able to be accessed through this app now is telling me I can't I don't understand why you people have to change things that work fine just leave it alone.

title: Updated app is worse than previous versions
body: Slow lag when grabbing quotes.  App freezes after placing orders at times.  Definitely not trader friendly.  I have to shut down the app and restart way too many times.  I'm going to look at other brokerage companies for better mobile device trading.

title: Love it!
body: Most used app on my phone! Very user friendly and seamless!

title: Crashes immediately every time I open it
body: I tried resetting my iPhone. No dice  app completely inaccessible now.

title: Pretty Good App
body: The sign out notification is completely unnecessary. Please remove it or give an option to disable it.

title: Helpful app  but a serious bug!
body: Everything runs smoothly on the app for me  except for one thing: when I go into one specific 401k plan and go to "sell" to liquidize some stocks  the entire app crashes. I have 3 accounts through Fidelity total  and the other 2 I have no problem moving money around and selling stocks. So there must be some system error with trading/selling.

title: Graph bug
body: I have an iPhone 5s. After the most recent app update  the line graphs in horizontal screen mode show as dots rather than lines.  If I switch to area graph and back to line  they look ok  but this has to be done each time I change the chart period or to a new stock.   Please fix.

title: Please fix
body: I really want to like this app. It's so convenient. But the numbers are just wrong. When I check my portfolio after the market closes the numbers shift right before my eyes. And  frustratingly  never in my favor. Please fix.

title: Update works ok  but badges broken
body: The update works for me mostly  but the badge display is completely screwed up. I get two alerts about a stock trade and the badge shows 67. I had thought it was showing some multiple  but it appears random. I guess someone forgot to update the icon’s associated value element correctly. Both the iPhone and iPad version of the app have the same error.  Also  the new app is a LOT slower. Recognition of taps take longer and transitions to other views is much slower even on an iPhone 5.

title: One of the best
body: I have tried most finance apps for iOS and can say that this Fidelity App is one of the best. It allows the right balance of features without becoming too complex for beginner but allows advanced investors access all the info they need. Bravo Fidelity.

title: Add research functions
body: Please add all research functions to app that are available online. ie mutual fund search and others.  *Also when I'm logged in I expect no delayed quotes  not acceptable for active trading.* I use this app everyday and what is available on the app is done very well  but I don't like that the app is essentially fidelity lite.

title: No 401K???
body: The 401(k) daily activity changed was included in the total before but not now. Why? It's Nice that Fidelity moved up with the new technology look  but you could you at least bring the quality along too?

title: Freezing all the time
body: This new version has not been debugged at all and was released to early. It freezes all the time  requires closing and opening the app.

title: NOT WORKING!!
body: I Haven't been able to log in  since I updated my iPhone software to iOS7. PLEASE FIX!! I Won't day trade until I can use this app.

title: New update is crap!!!
body: Not good. Can't load recent quotes or really do anything. Locks up!!!

title: No account info
body: After the update I'm able to log in but can't view my account. No data is loaded. Keep getting msg about account need yo view information.

title: No statements - No support - No help
body: Where are my statements? I guess I have to go to the web? Where is the support for the app? All I get is directed to the customer service page on Fidelity.com. No help in app.

title: Very bad
body: The last version is better

title: What a Shame!
body: This latest update seems to move the heavy lifting of the app over the web rather than in an actual local application.  It's basically a glorified web browser now.  If you are connected via wifi  no problem  but if you have any  ANY lag with your data connection  it will freeze  or cause you to follow links you didn't intend.  This is making me reconsider other brokerage houses.  Bloomberg news App does a better job at content presentation and has more tools even though it's news slant is appalling.

title: Awesome app but...
body: It's one of the best  but since last update if you have several accounts the daily change in your portfolio total is wrong  is the double of the net for all accounts. Please  correct it

title: Awesome
body: The new update is great! I love it.

title: Huge math bug:  2 + 0 = 4
body: I couldn’t find any support links so I’m posting the bug here:  On the main screen right when you get in (Account Balances)  it shows the day changes for each portfolio and the portfolio total.  The total portfolio DAY CHG is wrong!!!  By 2x!  It duplicates the DAY CHG in the first portfolio  instead of adding each portfolio change together.  It’s always exactly TWICE what my 1st portfolio change shows.  Nice one Fidelity! Great app overall but probably not tested well.  Hope they don’t make medical software too.  :o

title: Day CHG for portfolio total is not correct
body: The DAY CHG for portfolio total of a multiple account is not correct.  It shows twice the $ account as the real daily change.

title: Need better access to employee net benefits
body: This app is all but useless because I have no access to the pay portion of net benefits. This is really the only reason I need to use this app. Add this and I'll download the app again.

title: Good app
body: Works great for what it is.  I would like the ability to see some version of "Full View" though. It would also be nice to be able to get to the transactions for my fidelity credit card  or at least a link to the card website/portal as it is on the fidelity website.

title: Bad Security - Logs You Out  1Password integration missing
body: Incredibly frustrating that the app insists on logging you out constantly in some sort of bogus fake security gesture. I HAVE A PASSWORD ON MY PHONE. Please stop pretending that logging me out of the Fidelity app does anything. One can picture the internal discussion where someone from the security team insisted on this decision to the dismay of the designer who actually cared about the user experience.  The app at least looks better than the website  which is horrible  but rather than redesigning the visuals to look "flat" to match iOS7  the team should invest some time in making an experience that's enjoyable to use. That starts with not logging the user out every 20 minutes!!

title: THANK YOU!
body: Remember: Fidelity is NOT a bank  but a brokerage firm! And honestly this app exceeds the power of most other "banking" apps. Fidelity probably has the most efficient app out of any of their competitors. LOVE the new update!!!

title: Option strategies
body: Please  add options strategies

title: Best finance app ever
body: Their redesign for iOS 7 a bit late but definitely worth it. So beautiful  easy  and intuitive. Plain brilliant.

title: Fidelity investments
body: Works fine to view and search account info  but if you have a margin account you cannot use the buy or sell feature!  Disappointing feature lacking  but otherwise okay!

title: Great App
body: My 401k is with Fidelity and this app is a great way to track it on the go. Really like the way the new updates look as well. My only complaint would be I hate how every time I log on to my account I get an error message: Alerts Error...There was a problem connecting to Alerts.  Don't know what that means and wish it wouldn't pop up.

title: Simply awful
body: Horribly slow  with confusing interface.

title: Screen navigation
body: Please move the navigation button to the bottom of the screen and enable after hours trading.

title: Terrible update
body: I think they improved some functions within the app...but who can tell?  The fonts are so faint I can no longer read.  Give us a setting option to bold the text so we can use this app again.

title: Good app but missing stuff
body: I would like to see Full View - reports such as the listing of investments and transactions.   The way this capability is displayed better with Vanguard's app.   I would like the ability to have more research tools available.   Finally I would like the ability to review the last RIP  GPS  and PR results - the last PDF available for display.

title: Hard to use
body: New version is not nearly as easy to get a balance.  Many  many more clicks needed to see my daily balance change. Won't be using it. Will use desktop browser version instead.

title: Nice and not nice.
body: Looks good  but locks up constantly. Fix the bugs!

title: Seriously ??
body: This New Update? It has some terrible response issues. It's 3 times slower than the previous setup! Any new setup is somewhat difficult to move around on but not responding is a Glitch!..... That is all... ;)

title: Needs fixing
body: They screwed the pooch on this one. Under the home tab only so many stocks can be added until the app freezes  you have to close the app and go back into it and clear your list. Also  the option for filled candlestick charts do not work.

title: No
body: ILLUMINATI

title: Great potential But Slow to load!
body: Generally pleased with prior versions. Tried the iPad ver this AM and worked well  though still not as functional as the web version....why??  The iPhone ver just won't run - what kind of real time performance tools is the huge IT team at Fidelity using. Time to treat your customers like customers ... I want ALL the same function and performance on my mobile devices as web  only better !!  Get your team to step up seems this is someone's pet side project.

title: New Version is a Mess!
body: Freezes constantly; calculates two different numbers for day change $ on home page ... One is exactly double the correct number.   Not ready for prime time!  I doubt they tested it before dumping it in us.

title: Not Good
body: Help! New version freezes needs further testing.

title: Awful
body: The recent update looks good but the system locks up constantly.    I've used this for years and it keeps getting worse.  Every time it is updated the app becomes unstable.  Today I cannot sign-in.  Is this a joke?  For such a large origination I cannot explain how Fidelity gets away with this.  I reloaded the app and this cured a couple of things; when I buy the purchase priced showed up as a profit!

title: Unmanaged Assets don't show up
body: This is a very informative and interactive app. Fidelity is putting tremendous resources against this channel of customer interaction. There is a glaring error though where the app is not picking up the unmanaged assets in the sub-total and total assets calculations. When you drill down the detail is there  but it is missing at the summary level. Please fix this! It drives me back to the website which is not nearly as convenient.

title: Message alert - and no messages or alerts?
body: I'm generally happy with the app  but have an annoyance: It shows a red circle with a white number in the upper right of the icon when you have trade alerts  the same symbol as used on iPhone for missed phone calls/messages etc.  But when you log in  messages and alerts are not shown. Logging in and navigating is the only way to clear this number.  So this takes you...to no information?  What's the point?

title: Make the app work!
body: I click on "View Performance Info" and it says "Information not available." Don't offer links that don't work!

title: Horrible  do you even test it before you make it live?!
body: New version: often freezes. Charts keep defaulting to wrong chart type. No colors on bars up or down.  I often need to re- login.  If a Fidelity executive used this app he would head down to the IT group to figure out what's wrong. Make it work consistently please.Old version: Takes forever to load a quote. Pages load 80% of the time. I often need to re- login.  If a Fidelity executive used this app he would head down to the IT group to figure out what's wrong. Make it work consistently please.

title: Way to mess up!
body: Small thin fonts. Hard to read now on small iPhone screen!! Bring back large bold fonts for readability! Also please get rid of the blurry screen when signing in. It makes me feel dizzy and nauseous! Why would you put that in there anyway? For what purpose?

title: Works very well- need more :-)
body: #NAME?

title: Awesome app
body: Awesome - love the advanced charts.  I do most of my trading now using this app

title: No longer works!
body: For some reason the app does not connect to internet.  Login will not load and says I must be connected but I am connected via cell network and wifi.  All other apps work but reinstalling and updating Fidelity app yields no fix.  Anyone else having this issue?   Highly frustrating.

title: Poor user experience
body: I've been using this app for the past 12 months or longer at this point and find it lacking in a number of ways. Perhaps most frustrating is that the app does not show the date of purchase of a security / whether it's been held short or long term. Second  you actually have to remember how much you owe them for the credit card side of the app to pay the appropriate balance (it does not give you the choice of paying what you owe for the month!) these are just a couple of ways in which this app falls short.

title: Needs work
body: Has limitations in making trades. You'll be better off going to the web site via browser.

title: Crashes
body: I haven't been able to open this app without it crashing for months.  This is very disappointing because the app's functionality is an important service Fidelity should be providing its customers.

title: New Update No Show
body: I updated the app today and even though it is in my library it doesn't show up on the phone. It was working fine today before this update. I've deleted and reinstalled it twice but it still isn't showing up.

title: Trade Options not Working!
body: On both the iPhone and iPad versions of this app when placing an options order the order entry screen switches from options to stocks right after I enter the symbol and move to any other field on the screen. I even tried uninstall/reinstall of the app with the same result. Needs to be fixed!

title: Remote deposit doesn't work
body: I have the checking and brokerage and it tells me I can't use remote deposit.

title: Can't trade option spreads with app
body: Great app generally - easy on the go access to portfolio  watch list  market prices. But very limited if you trade options - no option view of your portfolio; not able to enter of modify orders for option spreads.

title: Crash Issues
body: This app constantly crashes when using the mobile deposit feature when photographing checks. Please fix ASAP.

title: Good enough
body: Good enough to view accounts and trade if you've already researched on a PC or iPad. Research is limited on the app.  Some cool features such check deposit are useful.

title: Market news never works in this version
body: Latest version of this app requires refreshing the news over and over to bring up the market news that is displayed in the website.

title: Crashes when depositing checks
body: The app works Ok otherwise. But it constantly crashes when uploading images during check deposits using the phone. I have tried numerous times but it keeps on crashing

title: Going in opposite direction?
body: PLEASE FIX THIS...After the update a couple of days ago- I see my closed positions as open. Takes forever to refresh. Please please fix this. PEOPLE rely on this App...am I the only one having a million issues with this app???

title: Update
body: Since the update this app does now work!

title: Only one bug that I've found
body: The red notification count on the app icon never clears once triggered it is there forever.  That's the bug.  The app support link in the AppStore takes you to the fidelity home page.  I don't call being prompted to create a brokerage account app support. So I'll just mark this as an unsupported app for now.   The things the app does are done well. I don't think it's reasonable to expect an app to completely support my investing needs so the web page will still be my trading platform.

title: Great app
body: Simple to use.

title: app freezes on trying to sell
body: the app freezes when i tried to do a transaction please kindly fix it

title: Good and simple but with some annoyances
body: Overall a good and simple app to check prices and portfolio.   However  why send me a notification that you logged me out? Just log me out. That is notification spam with no way to turn it off.

title: Placing orders
body: Is it me?  After I place an order I can't seem to find where to check on it or edit it!

title: Balances
body: The Fidelity app is so messed up. I access my account and it shows me my current balance  change screens and eventually return to see my balance again and it shows me something completely different. It just goes back and forth from a current balance to the previous balance  it's extremely annoying.

title: Unable to Login
body: This app is no longer useful. Can't login  and it can't remember my login username with that little checkbox checked. Thinking about uninstalling it

title: Crashes in 7.1
body: The app crashes instantly after the iOS 7.1 update. I don’t see any link in the app store to email the developer  and I don’t really want to wait on the phone to attempt to explain the problem. Hopefully this is fixed soon.

title: Roll back now please
body: Whatever just happened  please make it unhappen!  I used this app all the time and dropped my local bank on the strength of the check deposit feature.  Now the app won't even open (iP4).

title: App Crashes
body: App keeps crashing while depositing checks. One of the most used features. Aggravating they can't get it fixed with so many other older complaints.

title: Fix badge icon
body: Please fix badge icon.  It says 27 and there are no alerts

title: Watch list not getting current stock quotes
body: Newest update is a step backwards. My watch list is not able to pull stock quotes any longer. Says internet connection problem but it isn't. Won't work over wireless connected internet at home or over cellular 4g.

title: Crashes
body: Not sure what changed  used to work pretty good. Now it keeps crashing especially when trying to make deposits. I enter the account info and press the camera to snap a pic of the check it exits the app. I was going to send a message to support but that has changed too. I'm just routed to the full website and not able to log in using my iPhone. Painful process to find out the app doesn't work and support is almost none existent.

title: No Multi Leg Options?
body: Developer needs to update to add this feature.

title: App
body: App works ok. Not the best. Etrades app is a lot lot better. Etrade Shows you at what price you bought the stock at and and after hours   Fidelity does not show you after hours  so i believe. Don't like the way they display options

title: Bad
body: Won't open in iPhone 4.... Have loaded multiple times

title: Good  not great
body: I was surprised to read the unhappy reviews on this app. I would summarize the app as workmanlike  yet not spectacular.  I use the check deposit utility on a regular basis and have had no issues. In fact  compared to other financial institutions' check deposit functionality  in my opinion  Fidelity's is in the upper echelon. Money transfer and bill pay work very well.  Rarely use the trade utility but have never had a problem with the odd mobile trade.  My sole complaint is that the Full View utility is not included. More analysis and modeling options would also be appreciated. I hope that it is in a (near) future release.

title: Can't even log in
body: All i get is "the information you entered does not meet fidelity's security standards." Changing the password to a stronger one doesn't help. This app is useless.

title: Latest update fails to launch on iOS7
body: Doesn't load at all.

title: Worthless
body: Absolutely  utterly worthless.  Other than looking up an account  does not stay logged on. Tried to deposit a check. Crashed after snapping a picture.

title: Security problems
body: The latest version of the Fidelity app prevent you from pasting your password in - I use a password manager to having strong  unique passwords for each site.  But now that I can’t paste it in  I’m forced to use a weaker password that I can remember.  Bad move  Fidelity.

title: Available only on US App Store
body: How it comes that the app is available only in US Store? … while managing shares owned by people from all over the world. It’s not even on UK store...

title: Great app!
body: Great update not sure what others are commenting about. I haven't had any issues. I like the convenience of using my iPhone to access my accounts.

title: Check deposit has never worked
body: Generally pretty reliable. A bit unintuitive in places but gets the job done.

title: Complete fail
body: Won't open after update today

title: Don't do update!
body: Update is pointless. Hardly works after you install it.

title: Jan 27 update fixed individual positions
body: Individual positions were finally fixed in the Jan 27 update.  Took far too long to get that issue fixed  though  and the app is still not updated for iOS 7 (uses old keyboard).  Hoping for more frequent app updates in the future  but removed stars for the slow fixes and no iOS 7 version available yet. Otherwise the app is functional for my needs: viewing performance data and occasional purchases.

title: Crashes after update
body: Won't even start. Great update.

title: Invisible Ink
body: I would be a happy camper if the detail screens weren't written with invisible ink. IOS 7 has some great features  but the pastel on pastel color scheme is unacceptable. Has anyone with old eyes ever tried to read your Account History screen?  How about those three light gray lines of text(?) just above Log Out on Portfolio view that look vaguely like there may actually be some fine print there  but even with my glasses and Brightness at 33%  can't possibly read them. Come on! Is it that satisfying to make us feel ostracized as "over the hill"? Enough with the tiny grayed out fonts.

title: Disappointing
body: As a long-time Fidelity customer/client I was looking forward to using this app. I downloaded it when I had something going on with a purchase so I thought I could use it to keep on top of it. Two things. There’s two ways of calling Fidelity within the app  labelled something like Call Fidelity and Talk to An Agent. I tried both multiple times and got busy signals. Also  my pending trade didn’t show up on the app. Don’t know whether this was caused by a bug in the app but I didn’t get a very good first impression and don’t really trust it.

title: Good app.
body: I enjoy this app.  However  I have to use it in conjunction with other stock market apps just to keep track of things.  2 improvements that would save me a LOT of time:  Make it so you can swipe between stocks rather than clicking back then the next stock.   Include a pie chart for the portfolio.

title: Needs pie chart displaying portfolio asset allocation
body: This app is decent  but would be much better if it had a pie chart showing my portfolio asset breakdown by type in a pie chart. I have made stock purchases on-the-go  and would like to see how they affect my overall allocation without having to calculate this by hand.

title: Hate it
body: I cannot find the main features that I need in this worthless app and end up having to call Fidelity or use the main Fidelity website (which they also totally mucked up recently). This app is a total waste of space and useless except to check balances. Don't bother with it- is garbage.

title: Good app but needs fxn
body: Account information pages are not sized correctly.  After logging in i cannot see all of my account information as the aspect of the page does not fit onto iphone screen and there is now way to scroll around or zoom out. Please fix

title: Unable to cancel or modify some orders
body: Ok app.  You should create watch lists so you don't have to keep logging in for real time quotes. I learned the hard way about the gaps in conditional orders through app. Not only can you not create conditional order through app  but if you have an existing conditional order open you can't replace the order or even cancel it. Not cool.

title: Review
body: Doesn't load my stocks  always getting errors lately  please fix!

title: Unreliable
body: I agree with others. Check deposit is a great idea and even better if it works more than 50% of the time. Not the quality I expect from Fidelity.

title: M
body: I've had accounts at Schwab and their mobile app is vastly superior.  From  ease of use with regard to information on positions (i.e. Cost basis on individual lots/ dividend re-investments) to a simpler screen to read.  Also  the ability to take care of simple administrative items such as turning on and off dividend re-investments or other tasks was easily done via the Schwab mobile app.  The Fidelity app needs some serious work.

title: UPDATE PLEASE
body: The latest update will not show positions. Cannot make trades with App. Please correct this. When attempting its like its loading endless script.

title: Nice app if I could use it.
body: The app setup is great and easy to navigate but it constantly has errors and is out.

title: always have a download error
body: cannot update my balance

title: Needs some work
body: A better quotes/watch list giving bid/ask would be helpful.  Easier transaction menu from already purchased stocks/options would be great(buy/sell/increase position/decrease position  etc.). Options lists definitely need more work  as it's very difficult to navigate the site and find the options menu quickly. Additionally  the call/put options for any stock should not be as close together as they are… It's very easy to tap on the wrong one when trying to select action on one option.  A scrolling menu of choices/selections would be better for every parameter (i.e. buy/sell  call/put  buy to open  buy to close  sell to open  sell to close  etc). By contrast  TD Ameritrade's app is extremely functional and usable and it eliminates these chances of mistakes. Additionally  getting logged out every 30 minutes is frustrating. Login time should be customizable in increments up to eight hours and then let it automatically log you out.

title: Don't update! Removed streaming quotes
body: I had streaming quotes and noticed one small big that when here is no price change update it reverts to whatever the hotel was that you first opened the page on. I updated thinking they fixed the bug ... But instead there is NO STREAMING STICK QUOTES!  Great fix guys..

title: Check deposit
body: I have an iPhone5  software is updated  check deposit app is awful

title: Used to be a good app on iOS6
body: (Edit: you have to turn on heat map to get the color mapping. It used to be on by default. Now changed to 4stars) The color indicators that your stocks went up or down (light red/dark red - light green/dark green) are no longer available. It is so hard to see when your stocks changed in value easily. I now have to scroll to the side and check for values. I hope this gets fixed or optimized for iOS7

title: iOS 7
body: iOS 7 overhaul please!!

title: Charting?
body: Please add daily options charts....plus volumes as similar to iPad app as well for iPhone. Connectivity in mrkt last hour is skittish in previous version. Current ver still TBD.  Market makers were blamed previously when market order didn't execute in AAPL options...very leery of the non-resolution offered.

title: Fidelity App
body: This update's stability needs improved. One app failure per hour is less than acceptable.  Plus Fidelity  spend some money on a larger variety of news information. Your news doesn't have to Yahoo.finance  but it's grossly inadequate for many mid caps. You charge the same fee to trade them  so give us the news when they move.

title: Huge Improvement
body: I was dreading updating this app after reading others' reviews; however  the site left me no option once the original app became inoperative on the iPhone 4. Good news is that the iPhone 5S affords the full functionality of the site. No double logging in. Data is readable & accessible.

title: Localization unaware
body: This app works if General->International->Region Format is set to US or Canada (and probably some others ) but utterly fails if that setting is set to a region that doesn't use a period as the decimal separator in numbers (e.g. French Canada). I know this is a US company but  didn't you know  there are immigrants who live here. Maybe they don't set their preferences to use the US number format. Sloppy programming error.

title: Can't update new version
body: Can't update on IPod

title: Can't view employer sponsored acct
body: Just upgraded my iPhone 5 to iOS 7.0.3 and I can no longer view my employer sponsored acct. c'mon developers  you've had this issue in previous release...please get this fixed ASAP.

title: Have to input sign in info twice
body: I've had to sign in twice since the last update.  The first time it says the user I'd or password is incorrect.  When I input it the second time it's accepted.  Otherwise I like the app.

title: Montana
body: Really stupid. Those of us who don't want 5.0 are out the door. I have 4.3 on my iPhone so can no longer use this app. TDAmeritrade here I come.

title: Two flaws in the functionality of Pay Bills
body: 1)  The actual payee is not visible at any point if the bills have nicknames (like  "home - electric")  which most of mine do  so I have to scroll and hunt to find the bill I want to pay  2)  There's no opportunity to add a note on the comment line of the check or a private note to self (similar to Bill Pay online).

title: WORTHLESS
body: Deserves zero stars.  Cannot view any balances in cash management accounts  Cannot view any data at all in cash management accounts  Cannot transfer money between accounts  Needs a "save password" and PIN login  This app is beyond worthless. I hope to change this review soon  when it is fixed.

title: Make equity symbols red or green w daily rise/fall
body: I've been through several upgrades of this app. The first one was excellent--it mimicked the Fidelity website.   Every change since then has made it harder to use.   Go back to showing the stock names as green or red for each day. iPhone users have to scroll to the far right columns to find out the rise and fall for the day.   Ever since adding streaming quotes  I cannot scroll easily up-and-down or left or right to look at the data. There are constant pauses on the wrong equity.   Might as well Login to the Fidelity website instead of use this.

title: Deposit checks feature crashes app
body: Please fix asap

title: Like it but
body: I like the app and use it.  What I don't like is when in the portfolio review listing your purchases you cannot highlight one item then highlight a different one. It freezes on the one and you have to drill into it and blackout to select a different position.

title: Useless app
body: I need my mac now to trade or reference. Please let the old app work Without forcing the new on me

title: Forced upgrade useless
body: Newest upgrade not compatible with apple models older than a few years old.  Thanks for disabling last version so now app is useless as not all models are allowed to get v5.0.

title: Goodbye
body: The old app worked great on my iPod.  It is now gone. The new app won't work on my inks iPod.  Let me know when and if you get it resolved.

title: Not happy
body: Have 3 gs phone cannot log in!!! If I want to use this app I will have to buy a new phone! Might be cheaper to change brokerage firms?

title: Very poor
body: Needs a big improvement to what the app really needs to bring to the table.

title: Log in issues
body: I can not log in. Please fix.

title: Okay but uses to much data.
body: Data pig!  App itself is okay but uses lots of cell data for minimal tasks such as checking prices.

title: No mutual funds list
body: Why isn't there a list of available Fidelity mutual funds list like what Vanguard does? Are you afraid of showing how your funds are doing in the market?

title: Please enable after hours trading from app
body: The only reason I left fidelity for etrade is because of the lack of "after hours" trading options.

title: If it ain't broke...
body: This app worked fine for me - until the recent update. Now there are several major glitches - portfolio value consistently appears as $0.00  and lots of data are simply not accessible - and the company seems oddly oblivious.

title: Deposit check crash!!
body: Crashes after taking the second image of a check. Fix please!  This is limiting the single best feature of this app!!

title: New Versions are sluggish
body: I used to be able to open the Fidelity app to my Positions and scroll either up and down or left and right with ease. With the version 2 apps (iphone 4)  it takes a long time to open and after I've logged in and gone to my Positions  navigation is somewhere between erratic and non-existent.  I use my iPhone at breakfast in the morning to place orders at the open. This operation has made it almost useless to do this in a timely fashion.  In stock trading time=money and this costs me money.

title: Not good
body: I have to sign in twice. Even though I put same thing at first time.

title: Excellent app to keep up to date with my profile!
body: This app is user friendly and keen on the eyes. It helps me keep up to date with my profile and also keep my profile secure.

title: Message Center
body: Please add the message center to the app. When we get an email alert about a change to the account it would be nice to be able to login through the app to see the message vs clicking on the link in the email.  Otherwise the more recent enhancements are great and the app is user-friendly just like the website!

title: Freezes all the time. Really frustrating
body: I hate this ap but I need it.

title: App working again!
body: App working again with all cookies blocked.  Still needs a passcode option!

title: No alerts for Employer Sponsored Accounts
body: Thanks for redesigning the app. It's pretty nice now. But when I click on Alerts I get the following message  "You have requested a feature that requires an eligible Fidelity personal account". Does it really take many computer cycles to support Alerts? If I'm not eligible for Alerts  I'd rather not even see that in the list.

title: App does not work!
body: This has been going on for weeks now. Fix your app so it works with ios7.

title: Account Access Denied????
body: Was a great app until recently!  It is not good when you can't log in and see balances  pay bills  or trade stocks!!!  Please fix soon!

title: Can't access account after i0s7
body: Use this app everyday to buy  sell and monitor investments but it's been useless since I0s7! Very buggy upgrade but please fix app!

title: Doesn't work on iOS 7
body: Doesn't work on iOS 7.  Can't login.  Worked well on all previous versions of iOS.

title: iOS7 issue
body: After iOS7 update  you have  to re-enable cookies under settings/safari/cookies. App works great after that.

title: iOS 7 issues on iPhone 5
body: Haven't been able to Log in since upgrading to iOS 7 on an iPhone 5 or iPhone 4... Please fix already!

title: Great app now that crash bug fixed
body: Version 2.2.2 finally fixed the crash issue with this app. It is a very useful app if you are a fidelity customer and provides a very user-friendly interface. A must have for a Fidelity account holder!

title: Ios7 issues
body: Plain and simple can't login since iOS7 update on 4s.  Can get in fine on a laptop. Purely an app issue.  Please fix!

title: Needs an update for ios7!
body: Needs an update! Cannot log into the app. This is very important app for a non-traditional ebank for depositing checks etc!

title: Failure to log in and app crashes
body: I started experiencing trouble with this app about 2 weeks ago. It would hang up on the log on screen or crash during the rare times I was able to get logged in. Now that I've upgraded to iOS 7 of won't log in at all. Please release a fix ASAP. Many other lesser known apps released their iOS 7 updates immediately. I have a hard time believing a company as large as fidelity didn't plan ahead for this.

title: needs to be updated
body: This app should be redesign so that a person can access all of their accounts (IRA  401k  banking) in one app. In order to do so now  you have to download multiple of apps  which I feel is unnecessary.

title: App does not work on new iPhone 5s
body: This is written about previously that the fidelity app does not work with the in iOS7. Therefore my new iPhone 5s is not working with the fidelity app. I'm very disappointed in the app maintenance team at fidelity since this is a key resource for investors like myself who monitor portfolios at convenient times.

title: Update Issue
body: Why is it listed under "Pending Updates" after already updated in iOS 7?

title: Doesn't want to load
body: Can't get it to work nothing wants to load

title: App doesn't log in with iOS7
body: I really like the app  but it's currently not allowing me to log in. It gives the error: "Error getting account information. Please try again".

title: Bugs
body: Version 2.2.2 always says my account info is unavailable after I log in

title: Does what I need.
body: Does everything I need to do in a financial app.

title: iOS 7 now App doesn't work
body: iOS 7 now App doesn't work

title: Not working with OS7
body: Neither iPhone or iPad versions work for me. Gives a message saying data cannot be accessed.

title: Serious problem
body: This use to be a great app but now all it does is crash & deny account access please fix this ASAP

title: Good app with to satisfy my basic needs
body: I typically check my balances  stock quotes and monitor my watch list. Works well and is intuitive

title: Beautiful and functional
body: This is a really well designed app. There is still room for additional features but what it does  it does beautifully. Very intuitive and uncluttered interface.

title: Works for me
body: It works but the View Performance Info button take you to a non working web page.

title: works great for me!! not sure about those 1 star reviews...
body: works great!!

title: It used to be good
body: I used to use this app and thought it was really good.  Now it always crashes on the splash screen on my iphone making it completely useless.  It still works on my ipad though.  Please fix.

title: Alert doesn't clear
body: That red circle with the # of messages/alerts always remains there no matter how many times one logs into the site. It should disappear as soon as I visit the site...

title: Better Update Needed
body: App doesn't reflect full website functionality.  Can't even see stock notes on Watch List.

title: Unable to Open App
body: I am surprised that Fidelity has allowed their app to be non-functional on the iPhone for this long. I was trading daily with the app and have since switched services due to my fidelity app not working on my iPhone 4S got the last 2 months.

title: App hangs when opening
body: App tries to open and hangs. Only way to stop it is to delete it. I have tried to re install several times with the same result.

title: Works great for me
body: Errors reported by others in earlier reviews must have been fixed because the app works perfectly for me. Check deposit works. Bill pay works.

title: It works fine
body: I see a lot of bad reviews... Been using it for a few weeks now.  Does what it's supposed to.. Maybe they upgraded the new version before I downloaded. I use another app to track movement. But as for having an app to go along with my fidelity account.... Alerts work and It does the job.

title: Watch list issues
body: I use my own watch list. If I click on a symbol on it to view details eg AAPL it opens a totally unrelated symbol eg SLB. it's hard to view details from that watch list.   Also  I have two logins.I login using first one then add a 2nd login user and login. After this if I try to login using the first one (from the drop down) then it does not work and locks out the 2nd user.

title: Worthless app
body: App crashes as soon as you open it.  I reinstalled and it still does this.  Worthless at this point.  Fix this already Fidelity.

title: Great but not so great anymore
body: It was a great and used all the time until the update recently stops it from getting all the way up crashes at main screen can't get in anymore don't download till fix is issued. Will re-rate when update fixes problem.

title: Doesn't work
body: The app is pretty much useless - shows total portfolio value but can't pull any details through from your account.

title: After last update it is unusable edes
body: Constant "check your connection" or try again later  all this on 2 different iPhones 5  appear to work with the iPad .I contacted by phone tech support but the response was "thank you for letting us know" Includes version 2.2 When I called again I was treated like a little child that didn't know how to use the app I seriously consider switching companies

title: Disappointing
body: App version 2.2.1 crashes or cannot connect at all. Slow and unresponsive! Older version worked much better.

title: Can't log on
body: Haven't been able to log on with my iphone 4s for about 5 weeks now. Latest version didn't fix it. Used to work fine. Don't know where to go for help.

title: No research
body: I can't believe the app doesn't have research section. At least provide a link to the website.

title: CRASHES STILL
body: App still crashes with newest version at startup

title: Terrible app...Terrible company
body: My account information is constantly unavailable and then I suffer a crash every other time I attempt to login. I expect a lot better! This is yet another reason I'm pushing our employee benefits to another brokerage company. Fidelity is the absolute worst!

title: iPhone user
body: Awesome. The latest version crashes almost 1000 nano seconds faster than the previous version.

title: Still crashes!
body: This app is still crashing. It worked fine before the previous update. I've deleted and reinstalled numerous times with the same result .... Crash!  Highly disappointing  since I rely on this app when I'm in the field ...

title: Still Doesn't Work
body: I used to use this app all the time to transfer money  check prices  and buy and sell. Now all I get is the green splash screen and then it crashes. I have an iPhone 5 and the software is up to date and this useless app just takes up space on my phone. This app hasn't worked for several weeks and this latest version is just as useless as the previous rounds of updates and fixes. Apple should remove this from the App Store until Fidelity creates a version that actually works on the iPhone.

title: Great snapshot of accounts
body: I think this Fidelity app is excellent. I can see all of my accounts in one view. Also  I can easily deposit checks. The design of the app is top notch.

title: Review

title: Update Version 2.2.1 Still Crashes

title: Keeps Crashing!!! UPDATED
body: I have been trying to access this app since Friday!!! Every time I try  it crashes. I have re-installed and tried again. NOTHING!!!! Fix please!!! TODAY IS AUG 11  2013 I posted on Aug 6  2013 my complaint. This app still does not open anymore!!!!

title: No rush to fix it...??
body: ...From excellent to terrible.  The current app update renders iPhone useless for reliable trading & quotes  as screen  has slow  inconsistent response time or simply freezes up.  Fidelity tech now claims no knowledge of these problems  in spite of calls for a fix for over a month...

title: Bad app don't waste your time!!!!!!
body: it used to work  not anymore  won't open tried redownload but no good  just deleted app  can't even give 1 star rating but can't submit without it.

title: Bye bye Fidelity
body: Same as noted by others. Was using this regularly when suddenly all I get is a frozen Fidelity screen. Also have noticed I can't log on to fidelity from my laptop anymore. thought it might but now I'm wondering. And these folks handle my money????? Did they skip town???

title: C'mon Fidelity - this app really went down hill.
body: The application ceases to function. Every single time I attempt to log in the application crashes and quits. Entirely unusable.

title: Terrible
body: Doesn't work  simply crashes.

title: Crashing!
body: Sure would be nice to deposit a check without the app crashing.

title: Pure Garbage
body: I should probably move my account.

title: Annoying
body: I can no longer log in to see my account. I'm very annoyed.

title: Trader
body: Would like to see extended hour trading function

title: Bug Report
body: It now saves previous logins  but I use 2 different logins and it offers me both via a drop down list  but when I select the second login and type in the password and try to login  it reverts back to the first login and then fails since I gave it the password for the second login.  And I don't see any way to get past it  so now I can't login with my primary account any longer :(

title: Doesn't recognize account types or correct balances
body: This app is just not very user-friendly. I love Fidelity  but there's a lot of work to be done on this app. It displays incorrect account balances (shows that one of my accounts had no money on it) and it won't even allow me to deposit a check (it says I don't have he proper account when I do). To me this app is pretty much useless until they fix these issues.

title: Crashes an awful lot
body: This application crashes three or four times daily when I use it  sometimes when I log in. Most often times it crashes after I update the watch list.  I hope I am fortunate and it doesn't crash during the trade execution.

title: Won't deposit checks

title: Review
body: Made 6 separate purchases today.  At the close of the day I go to the orders screen to review my purchase prices to compare them against the closing prices  Impossible to do from that screen!  Why wouldn't there be a current quote or closing price there?  So I see that I purchased xyz stock at 30.  To see where it closed I have to go through 3 different screens.  Then 3 different screens to get back to the orders screen to see where I purchased the next stock. Then 3 more screens to get that quote.  And so on and so forth.  36 screens in total just to see how I did today!  Terrible!!  Who signed off on this latest update??  Go back to previous versions which were much more user friendly.  Please!!

title: Push alerts  thank you!

title: Great!!!

Then your balance can be whatever...I think that is dumb but hey. Still love the app as it is super simple!   I love this app and this bank! Its so convenient! Im able to pay my bills with a breeze! So excited about the check deposit even though its not working...im going to contact them about this!  Im also going to open my grandma an account so i can easily do her bills instead of writing them out >_<

title: Much worse than previous version!
body: In this version  Fidelity removed this app's most powerful tool--the ability to compare graphically pairs of investments  including stocks  mutual funds  and ETFs  for periods of up to five years. For me  without this capability  the app is now essentially useless. Anyone who thinks this app is good never used the previous version  or they work for Fidelity.????  The latest update 2.02 provides limited ability to compare the performance of two investments  but the timeframe can't be changed. Also  colors such as red and green lack saturation. I can't tell the difference between them. This is a serious problem. Furthermore  the text size varies too much. Some text is much too large; some is too small. This app would benefit from redesign by a human factors specialist.

title: Loathing the updated interface
body: With the flashy color  shiny round icons  and green dot vs red dot simplifications  it seems the developer wants to make managing a portfolio more like playing a low-tech game for preschoolers. Meanwhile  the font size of the information which truly matters  the numbers on the Positions tab after the Subaccounts headings under the Accounts page (which by default is the third swipe from the opening screen) is absurdly tiny. It's hard to see on a phone  and as a result I have gone back to my laptop to manage my accounts. I truly regret installing this update and wish for an Undo feature on the whole experience. Is your UI design team all interns?

title: Lousy update
body: The updated Fidelity app  in my opinion  is ugly  dark and harder to use compared to the prior version. Eliminating the navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen in favor of the new navigation bar at the left makes it harder to use. Now you may have to tap/slide multiple times to get to the navigation. Putting the box to enter a symbol for a quote right below the log out button was just dumb; I have logged out accidentally enough from this.  The account display was far better in the old version; you could see at a glance price changes in securities without having to scroll or tap on individual stocks in your portfolio. Similarly  in the old version there was a nice  clean chart of the major indexes on the home screen. Now  there's an ugly screen with only current data; to see the chart you have to tap on each index  one at a time.   I primarily use the Fidelity app to see my account positions and market action  to check stock quotes  and to trade  and this update has made all of those things frustrating.

title: No iPhone 5 support
body: I concur with the other current reviewer that if an application comes out and upgrades with support for iOS 6 the assumption is it also supports the iPhone 5. This is not the case here as it still has black on the top and the bottom so it obviously still only supports the iPhone 4 display.   I guess they just tested to make sure that running under iOS 6 did not give them a problem. Without a description here at the iTunes store I cannot tell what other enhancements there are if any.  It is nice that at least the app takes advantage of some of the iPhone 4S enhancements that carried over to the iPhone five such as SIRI so that you can speak in stock ticker symbols to get a quote.  What continues to make this app invaluable to me is its ability for me to deposit checks without having to go to a Fidelity branch.

title: iPhone deposit needs help
body: I like using the app and was excited when they add remote deposit feature via iPhone photo. That excitement was short lived as the failure rate is amazingly high.  First had to retake photo 15 times as it kept saying "cannot read numbers on bottom of check". Second when it finally did work in rejected my deposit as name didn't match name on account. It matches but the computer couldn't read the handwriting so it just denies. When I call the rep says "yep it matches I see the check here on the screen sorry nothing I can do to override rejection". Mean time the back of check says "deposit to fidelity only" and now I cannot take to my bank and I have to mail it in.  Not sure if I will be willing to try this again.

title: Not as functional as fidelity.mobi site some bugs
body: App is almost there but needs some enhancement and bug fixes to rate higher.  App is generally faster and easier to type and navigate but not as functional as the fidelity.mobi site. I use it when I need to do simple things otherwise I am forced to use the mobi site.  App cannot seem to do: sell using tax lots; international trading; extended hours trading. Perhaps other things.  Also the order status and position pages sometimes seems to have a refresh problem in some circumstances that displays minutes-old wrong data.  I downgraded the rating from 4-stars to 2-stars due to the data refresh bugs I seem to experience.

Yet all my other Apps are able to download data.  2) When trying to read news and select the last row there isn't enough screen space to select the Investing Ideas section.   It's almost like you have no quality control over your software development processes. This makes me nervous about using Fidelity.

title: Check deposit doesn't work with UPPERCASE EMAILS
body: During the account opening process at Fidelity they convert everything to uppercase because that is what poor programmers do.   For some reason this app has a bug that if your email address is uppercase (as it would be after opening your account) it will not recognize you having a valid email. Change it to lowercase and it will work. (Standard restrictions aside such as 30+ days since opening and initial $2500 opening deposit)

I was most excited about the bill pay feature and that is one of my primary uses.  The bill pay feature works but you can only pay bills that appear on the screen as it is originally loaded.  I have more payees than can appear on one page so I need to scroll.  If you scroll for some reason it will not let you schedule a payment.  I hope this is fixed in a future release.

Keep it up!

title: Needs Multitasking & Streaming Quotes

If this auto-logout is intentional i.e. someone's idea of a security feature I disagree with it and request that it be eliminated to allow meaningful multitasking.  At a minimum users should be able to turn on multitasking manually.  Please also consider adding real-time streaming quotes akin to Active Trader Pro.  Finally BillPay would be nice as well.

title: Doesnt guarantee privacy accuracy
body: The Agreement required to be signed before using the app states Fidelity is not responsible if the transaction gets intercepted and your privacy is breached.  If their encryption fails you are still responsible!  Anything else they do wrong you are completely responsible unlike if you were using your home computer.  I dont know if this would hold in court but it certainly doesnt give a warm and fuzzy about the mobile app if they absolve themselves of all and any responsibility.  They also dont guarantee the accuracy of data they display or whether any orders can be executed correctly.  I can understand if you are not careful with your password or mobile device and somebody else gets a hold of it and is able to do a transaction you should be liable.  But they should at least take responsibility for losses if their encryption doesnt work and they breach data security.  The agreement also says you have to call them after a transaction to get a printed copy which is different than if you were using a home computer.  With a home computer you can set it so that you get written confirmation of all your transactions.

title: Keep me logged in

title: Will not keep you logged on while multiple-tasking
body: I like to trade stocks with this app.  The problem is it will not keep you logged on while multi-tasking between apps.  Multi-tasking is a very important feature of iPhone. It was developed for the reason of switching between apps without the hassle of shutting one down to open another one up. The problem with this app is every time you switch out of it it logs you out and you have to log back in.  This is a hassle when your trying to make a timed trade as it takes a minute every time you log in.  Very annoying and time consuming.  Talked to app development about it and he said it was a valid complaint and would be fixed in the next version but was not.  Td ameritrade is a much better app as it will keep you logged on.  Switching my accounts over to TD as I trade frequently from my phone.

Cannot even enter an exact amount an it changes your bid price! Incredible that could get past requirements and testing! Completely useless for anything but two decimal point value trading.

title: If at first you don
body: I just downloaded this for the new iPod Touch to check my NetBenefits balance (employer 401K).  The first time I tried to access it it showed a zero which about caused cardiac arrest.  I shut the thing down and went to the website and all was OK.  Just a few minutes later I checked the iPod again and everything was functioning OK and jibed with the regular website info.  After that I could get a good deal of pertinent data which will be very useful for me. Satisfied it will work.

title: Working but needs cut/copy/paste support!!
body: This app is working pretty well for me but has a -major- usability problem: no support for cut/copy/paste!  There are many usage scenarios this makes difficult here is just one:  I trade options and I subscribe to some directed trading newsletters. These newsletters specify numerous option symbols to be traded. What I want to be able to do is copy each option symbol to the clipboard then get onto the Fidelity app and paste a symbol into the option trading screen.  Not being able to do this is a major pain because I have to keep bouncing back and forth between the app and the email trying to remember the symbols (which are more complex then stock symbols).  Of course each time I have to do this I have to log into the app again!!  Another place copy/cut/paste would be huge is inside the app itself.  If I look up an option chain inside the app I should be able to copy option symbols from there to other places like the quote screen or the trading screen.  If copy/cut/paste support was added throughout the entire app it would be 5 stars!

title: App auto-closes too frequently
body: The app shuts down after approximately 15 minutes with or without active use.  Then required to relaunch and setup your monitoring screens while often missing a trading opportunity. Please update the APP to not auto-close or do so based on an inactivity time period.

All in all glad to have something.

title: Does not support 401k

title: Quickly falling behind other broker apps
body: Fidelity needs an update and a dedicated iPad app. This app while functional and sufficient for most purposes has nowhere near the information or friendly UI as the eTrade or TDAmeritrade apps. I would expect much more from Fidelity.

title: Useless!!!
body: Horrible app!!! Completely useless for something as basic as checking account balances!!!

title: Limited use

title: Junkware

title: No 401k netbenefits app is useless

title: Horribly slow
body: If you are a serious investor or trader this app is not for you. It's just too slow. Using www.fidelity.mobi in Safari is much better. Wish I could give it zero stars.

title: Check deposit
body: Good app. I'd REALLY like a photo check deposit feature as well.

title: Any plans on making an iPad version of this app?
body: I use this app to track and trade my accounts with Fidelity.  It is easy to use and thoughtfully designed in that I can get around from quote to placing trade instructions to monitoring working trades across several accounts very quickly.  Any plans of building an iPad version of this app?  I currently use the iPhone version on my iPad - a native iPad version would be great.

title: Great iPhone app now just make it compatible for iPad
body: I like the interface on the phone my only complaint is that your portfolio or individual stocks aren't shown side by side to make it a little bit easier to see the relevant news on the go. Right now I no longer use the app because it looks really bad on the iPad. I think it'd be a great iPad app and then I could have my portfolio info and trading capacity all on the same screen.

title: No trailing trades??
body: Great app but no option for trailing trades! I use the app to quickly check positions but when I really need to trade I have to log into the slow website and put trades in through there. Doing it via the app would be so much faster! Also please update with iOs 4 support so I don't have to login everytime I switch apps. And an iPad version would be awesome.

title: Needs trailing stop!
body: The app works well but when I need to post a trailing stop I have to use the website. Please add trailing stop % and $ and I will post a 4 or 5 star review.

title: No 401-K data
body: Does not display information for NetBenefits. What a disappointment.

title: Very useful app...iPad app next?
body: This Fidelity iPhone app is a big improvement over the web-based mobile application. I would like to see Total Daily Gain/Loss in small print under the total for each account when you select Positions and the total daily gain/loss under the Portfolio Total on the main Accounts page. Is a fully functional iPad application in the works? I sure hope so...

title: All I need!!!
body: It does all I need it to do! Check my accounts get quotes and buy and sell shares!

title: It's ok but needs a few more things
body: I was waiting for Fidelity to release this app.  I was eager to try it when it finally arrived.  It's ok - provides the basics but it needs 1) access to Bill Pay 2) ability to transfer between accounts 3) landscape mode and 4) an iPad version!.  Please add these Fidelity!

title: Nice but where is NetBenefits?
body: Please support integration of NetBenefits.

title: Like the workplace savings addition!
body: But I agree with the other poster...now we just need the ability to use online bill pay and make transfers and this app will really be top notch!

title: Easy to use needs totals
body: This version is easy to access and has clear readable print. It's easy to trade as well.   My one complaint is that you cannot see totals of the gain or loss in your portfolio. It has this information for individual stocks ( although it would be nice to see gain and percentage gain at the same time) but it has no totals.   I would like to see a landscape version with more columns but would especially like totals.

title: Not bad
body: Would like to see a landscape mode and or a full iPad version otherwise it is OK.

title: Doesn't support NetBenefits
body: Needs to support NetBenefits to be useful to most people put there. Most of the biggest companies use this.

title: Great App
body: Helps trade when not in front of a computer

title: Worthless to me without NetBenefits
body: Upgraded app to 3 stars. Has NetBenefits but doesn't support trading for it.   The mobile browser can access this info why not the native app?

title: Great for trading stocks!!
body: Gives live updates for all stock positions and allows you to trade and buy instantly! Great app and I like the update that prevents the device from remembering the account name if selected.

title: Can't connect
body: No idea if this app is any good or not.  Can't connect to the server.  I tried for 3 days at all different times

title: Great improvements in this update
body: Someone must have called in usability because this version is a HUGE improvement.

title: Needs NetBenefits
body: This is a promising app but it does not currently support NetBenefits. This cuts out lots of people (75000 just in my company) including myself. Luckily we'll still be able to manage online through their site.

title: Needs More
body: I'm a Fidelity customer so it is useful to check my balance and performance when I'm away from my laptop. I can do this with other apps but I would have to manual keep up with my holdings. That's all good...  But it really needs more research capability analytical charting and especially the ability to receive a flag when a set price has been reached for specific stocks.

title: The addition of NetBenefits makes the app
body: Now that NetBenefits is supported this app is actually worth having.

title: Needs totals
body: Nice app but would be much better if it gave a  total gain/loss for the portfolio.

title: New update!

title: No billpay?

title: Love it

title: Pretty good

title: Awkward...
body: Doesn't allow you to trade fron Positions screen. Odd selection of views for Positions. Etc. Sticking with Mobile Fidelity for now from which I'm doing dozens of trades per week.

title: For trading only

title: Fidelity Moblie is better option than app
body: Used app a couple of times.  Returned to Fidelity moblie internet to access quotes and accout.  Dissapointed in this product. Slow to load compared to moblie version.  Not well organized.  Need clearnr and faster quotes.  Looks like they just added time and date to qoute.  This should have be part of initial release.  Home page usless

title: No access to net benefits
body: Come on Fidelity what's the issue with making this app actully useful and providing access to accounts on Net Benefits. You charge enough in managment fees!

title: Easy way to view my portfolio quickly on iPhone.
body: I'm not a heavy trader so the features of this app are perfect for me. I can check the status of my stocks easily and trade if I need to. Active traders thinking this app should be their main trading portal are idiots and should not be trading stocks.

title: No workplace 401k access
body: What a joke leave put your biggest clientelle....

title: not complete
body: I bought it to monitor my company's saving plan and it might have been nice it they would have mentioned that this feature is not available yet. Many people will be buying this for that reason. So the two stars is for an incomplete description of the product.

title: Should not default Action to Buy like it does.
body: If you look at Fidelity's website you'll see you always have to select the Action. In this application Action is already set to Buy and I think that's wrong. Yesterday I accidently bought when I wanted to sell. Any trading application should not default Action to anything and make the user think about what they are doing. If you look at iStockManager it doesn't default to anything and this application shouldn't either.

title: Neither more nor less
body: This app from Fidelity does exactly what I want it to do. No push no pull no distractions. Clear and easy.

title: Great for day trader.
body: Love this app. I guess if you don't have a Fidelity account this app my seem lame.  But if you do and are a active trader it is faster than online.  I trade options daily and find this app the perfect tool for my trades.

title: Needs workplace accounts
body: Does not support workplace accounts. Says feature is coming soon but we will see. If this is added my review would be at least 4 stars. Not very useful without it.

title: No workplace 401k
body: This app looks like it could be really helpful but does not yet support workplace accounts. When it does I will re-evaluate but until then it gets one star as it for me does nothing.

title: Thank you for History!
body: Originally the app didn't have History which is what I login for most of the time. Thanks for paying attention to feedback!

title: Need More
body: I was looking to get a daily total - portfolio up or down for the day.
Needs to use a PIN and device ID instead of requiring the password every time.

title: Add Billpay
body: And I would rate this an immediate 4 or 5. Don't trade a ton so cash management is invaluable

title: Professional trader and investor
body: Good job Fido!  I was very pleased with this application.  Sure I could produce a wish list just like those before me but that's not a reason to dog the app.  Keep up the good work.  For those considering the FREE download don't think twice just do it. I love the charts trading and account info. Looking forward to the enhancements that I am sure will come.  I have had no download issues or software bugs.  Thanks Fido.   (have fiber optic connection to router)   (I've been investing since 1983 and have worked for 5 blue chip securities firms.  Currently invest with several firms. Trading multiple mil $.)

title: Fidelity app NOT comparable to the much BETTER  E.TRADE App.
body: All I can say  is this as soon as E.Trade eliminates ASF (Account Service Fees) IM switching to E.trade. E.trade app can do So much more so much better.  Fidelity app is spartan at best.  Very basic basic basic just to BUY/SELL stock. everything else is SUBStandard.  IF you can Foot the $160/year bill Go Etrade.  Just my experience. PS. remember I Stop using Etrade because of the ASF. Scottrade Dont even mention it.  Hope Fidelity IMPROVE! Rafael

title: not ready for prime time
body: I was excited to see this app because Ive been using the mobile web site for a while. Unfortunately this app makes your smart phone dumb. When you switch back to your home screen you get logged out. This makes this app unusable. I will sadly continue to use the mobile web site instead because it keeps me logged in way better than this garbage. Another complaint I have is that I lose my watch list stock ordering. It's annoying but I could deal with that if it kept me logged in at least to see my watch list! Yep the web site is slow and with recent changes has some fonts that are too small. Fidelity customers have bad options for smart phone access right now. Fix this app!!!!

title: Account Transfers
body: I would love to be able to trasnfer money between accounts.

title: Better than the website
body: I've spent all of two minutes with this app and one thing is clear: it's way better than their website. Not like that's saying much.   I'd like to see a better P/L view but overall this is pretty good.

title: Very polished but
body: When I swap out Trade with Latest News then exit and relaunch Trade is still there. Doesn't seem to save my preference.

title: NOT BAD

title: M

body: I would use this app and promote Fidelity a ton more if this app allowed me to use their billpay service.  Let's go Fidelity!

title: Fidelity app

title: S l o o o o o w w w w w w. . .

News takes forever to load even on a Wi-fi set-up that transfers data at 30mg.  This needs some serious improvement.

I don't mind a bit that u can't check 401k info. That's not the intent. Do u really need to check your 401k balance multiple times a day?

title: Be clear up front no 401k

title: All good

title: Let down

title: Nice start
body: Nice start but no netbenefits! FAIL! I'll reinstall once you update the app with the netbenefits 401k.

title: Mother of two
body: Love this app. I have access to everything I need and when I want it. Thanks Fidelity!

title: If you trade with Fidelity get it.
body: Huge improvement over previous version. Nice clean charts heat map on watch lists quickly show you what's up/down. It is fast and clear in execution. Congratulations to the develepment team.

title: Should have read reviews
body: Before downloading the app. When you add the 401k accts to this I will change the rating.

title: AWESOME!!!
body: This app is fantastic. It is easy to use and very intuitive. You can check your stocks throughout the day and place trades wherever you are. Even catch up on the news. Best of all ITS FREE!   I bet dollars to doughnuts that the bad reviews were paid for by someone over at Etrade. Why would anyone with a Netbenefits account want to check it all of the time? Netbenefits only updates once a day! If you want an icon that badly then make one using Safari.   Note about Etrade. They are a publically traded firm who lost a ton of money during the subprime debacle of 2008. Clearly they are getting deaperate otherwise why write such horrible reviews? Plus would you trust your money to a baby? Or a privately held firm that has had some of the most iconic fund managers behind it.

title: Fail
body: No 401k or netbebefits....really?!?!?!

title: Need to add 401K account access
body: App seems to work fairly well for trading accounts but you cannot access your 401K or Netbenefit account data.

title: Good app
body: I'm surprised how negative the reviews are. The app is FREE people. So it doesn't support netbenefits right now the description says support is coming and all the other account types are supported right now. Some of these reviews are so venomous it makes me wonder if etrade asked all their employees with iPhones to leave poor reviews.

title: solid trading app...beats mobile website
body: this does everything it should do.  it does not support netbenefits...and nor should it.  your nb account is a long-term account that should be looked at monthly if not quarterly.  quit whining about not being able to actively trade your $5k of institutional class mutual funds that are priced daily.  get a freedom fund or PAS management and quit wasting peoples time and energy.

title: Fidelity's iPhone App v1.1
body: I have found this app to work very well and be quite intuitive to use. It's very handy to access and manage my accounts without having to be at a computer. It *would* be nice to initiate a trade on a particular holding within a particular account like the full Fidelity web site allows you to do instead of having to select everything manually (including the desired account) each time you want to initiate a trade. That being said I'm sure the app will improve over time since this is only version 1.1. I have been a Fidelity account holder for over 20 years and I feel like Fidelity does a great job of embracing technology and listening to the customer's needs.

title: No 401k?????
body: Terrible app that completely ignores their main customers! Poor app

title: Does not support 401K data!!!
body: Why would fidelity produce an app that works for the "investment side of the house" but yet ignore customers with 401k retirement investments? Shame on fidelity for such poor customer service!! Are your fund managers this out of date??

title: No support for my accounts
body: Apparently having a 401(k) through Fidelity doesn't make you a REAL customer in their eyes.

title: Use etrade
body: I have an etrade and a fidelity account and I was amazed that a company like fidelity would put an app out like this.  It shouldn't surprise   most people that these apps drive business for these companies.    Basically I'm saying I will be trading more with etrade because of the ease of their app.  Fidelity was better off not posting an app than to put this out on apple.  Bad marketing Bad Business.

title: Should have read the reviews
body: I'm sure this be a fine app. I have a Fidelity 401k account. At least fidelity has a mobile web page for me. The 1-star is for a lack of clarifying who can log in with a right to revise my review once I get 401k info in the app.

title: Doesn't work for me.

title: No netbenefits support
body: Why make a program which leaves out a large portion of your account holders. Hopefully 401k account access will be added soon.

title: Good app

body: Can't check my 401k. Hope to change this review once net benefit login is supported
